verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:66
verses.text: Let the two be, one a slave, the other an adopted son: and let both offend Him, the one as a disinherited child, the other as a fugitive, and one who never knew a father.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:67
verses.text: Then let both be made heirs, both trueborn sons.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:68
verses.text: Behold, they are exalted to one and the same dignity, the two are become one, the one coming from a longer, the other from a nearer distance, and the slave becoming more noble than he was before he offended.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:69
verses.text: "And brake down," he proceeds, "the middle wall of partition".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:70
verses.text: What the middle wall of partition is, he interprets by saying, "the enmity having abolished in His flesh, even the law of commandments contained in ordinances".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:71
verses.text: Some indeed affirm that he means the wall of the Jews against the Greeks, because it did not allow the Jews to hold intercourse with the Greeks.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:72
verses.text: To me, however, this does not seem to be the meaning, but rather that he calls "the enmity in the flesh," a middle wall, in that it is a common barrier, cutting us off alike from God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:73
verses.text: As the Prophet says, "Your iniquities separate between you and Me;" (Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:74
verses.text: lix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:75
verses.text: ) for that enmity which He had both against Jews and Gentiles was, as it were, a middle wall.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:76
verses.text: And this, whilst the law existed, was not only not abolished, but rather was strengthened; "for the law," saith the Apostle, "worketh wrath".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:77
verses.text: (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:78
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:79
verses.text: ) Just in the same way then as when he says in that passage, "the law worketh wrath," he does not ascribe the whole of this effect to the law itself, but it is to be understood, that it is because we have transgressed it; so also in this place he calls it a middle wall, because through being disobeyed it wrought enmity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:80
verses.text: The law was a hedge, but this it was made for the sake of security, and for this reason was called "a hedge," to the intent that it might form an inclosure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:81
verses.text: For listen again to the Prophet, where he says, "I made a trench about it".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:82
verses.text: (Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:83
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:84
verses.text: ) And again, "Thou hast broken down her fences, so that all they which pass by the way do pluck her".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:85
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:86
verses.text: lxxx.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:87
verses.text: ) Here therefore it means security and so again, "I will take away the hedge thereof, and it shall be trodden down".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:88
verses.text: (Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:89
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:90
verses.text: ) And again, "He gave them the law for a defence".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:91
verses.text: (Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:92
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:93
verses.text: ) And again, "The Lord executeth righteous acts and made known His ways unto Israel".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:94
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:95
verses.text: ciii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:97
verses.text: ) It became, however, a middle wall, no longer establishing them in security, but cutting them off from God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:98
verses.text: Such then is the middle wall of partition formed out of the hedge.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:99
verses.text: And to explain what this is, he subjoins, "the enmity in His flesh having abolished, the law of commandments".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:100
verses.text: How so? In that He was slain and dissolved the enmity therein.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:101
verses.text: And not in this way only but also by keeping it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:102
verses.text: But what then, if we are released from the former transgression, and yet are again compelled to keep it? Then were the case the same over again, whereas He hath destroyed the very law itself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:103
verses.text: For he says, "Having abolished the law of commandments contained in ordinances".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:104
verses.text: Oh! amazing loving-kindness! He gave us a law that we should keep it, and when we kept it not, and ought to have been punished, He even abrogated the law itself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:105
verses.text: As if a man, who, having committed a child to a schoolmaster, if he should turn out disobedient, should set him at liberty even from the schoolmaster, and take him away.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:106
verses.text: How great loving-kindness were this! What is meant by,  "Having abolished by ordinances?"  For he makes a wide distinction between "commandments" and "ordinances".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:107
verses.text: He either then means "faith," calling that an "ordinance," (for by faith alone He saved us,) or he means "precept," such as Christ gave, when He said, "But I say unto you, that ye are not to be angry at all".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:108
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:109
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:110
verses.text: ) That is to say, "If thou shalt believe that God raised Him from the dead, thou shalt be saved".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:111
verses.text: (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:112
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:114
verses.text: ) And again, "The word is nigh thee, in thy mouth, and in thine heart.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:115
verses.text: Say not, Who shall ascend into heaven, or who shall descend into the abyss?" or, who hath "brought Him again from the dead?" Instead of a certain manner of life, He brought in faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:116
verses.text: For that He might not save us to no purpose, He both Himself underwent the penalty, and also required of men the faith that is by doctrines.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:117
verses.text: "That he might create in Himself of the twain, one new man".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:118
verses.text: Observe thou, that it is not that the Gentile is become a Jew, but that both the one and the other are entered into another condition.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:119
verses.text: It was not with a view of merely making this last other than he was, but rather, in order to create the two anew.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:120
verses.text: And well does he on all occasions employ the word "create," and does not say "change," in order to point out the power of what was done, and that even though the creation be invisible, yet it is no less a creation than that is, and that we ought not henceforward start away from this, as from natural things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:121
verses.text: "That He might in Himself of the twain".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:122
verses.text: That is, by Himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:123
verses.text: He gave not this charge to another, but Himself, by Himself, melted both the one and the other, and produced a glorious one, and one greater than the first creation; and that one, first, was Himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:124
verses.text: For this is the meaning of "in Himself".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:125
verses.text: He Himself first gave the type and example.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:126
verses.text: Laying hold on the one hand of the Jew, and on the other of the Gentile, and Himself being in the midst, He blended them together, made all the estrangement which existed between them to disappear, and fashioned them anew from above by fire and by water; no longer with water and earth, but with water and fire.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:127
verses.text: He became a Jew by circumcision, He became accursed, He became a Gentile without the law, and was over both Gentiles and Jews.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:128
verses.text: "One new man," saith he, "so making peace".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:129
verses.text: Peace for them both towards God, and towards each other.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:130
verses.text: For so long as they continued still Jews and Gentiles, they could not have been reconciled.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:131
verses.text: And had they not been delivered each from his own peculiar condition, they would not have arrived at another and a higher one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:132
verses.text: For the Jew is then united to the Gentile when he becomes a believer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:133
verses.text: It is like persons being in a house, with two chambers below, and one large and grand one above: they would not be able to see each other, till they had got above.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:134
verses.text: "Making peace," more especially towards God; for this the context shows, for what saith he?  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:135
verses.text: "And might reconcile them both in one body unto God through the Cross".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:136
verses.text: He saith, not merely "might reconcile," (καταλλάξῃ) but "might reconcile thoroughly" (ἀποκαταλλάξῃ) indicating that heretofore human nature had been easily reconciled, as, e.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:137
verses.text: g.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:138
verses.text: , in the case of the saints and before the time of the Law.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:139
verses.text: "In one body," saith he, and that His own, "unto God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:140
verses.text: How is this effected? By Himself, he means, suffering the due penalty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:141
verses.text: "Through the cross having slain the enmity thereby".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:142
verses.text: Nothing can be more decisive, nothing more expressive than these words.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:143
verses.text: His death, saith the Apostle, hath "slain" the enmity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:144
verses.text: He hath "wounded" and "killed" it, not by giving charge to another, nor by what He wrought only, but also by what He suffered.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:145
verses.text: He does not say "having dissolved," he does say "having cancelled," but what is stronger than all, "having slain," so that it never should rise again.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:146
verses.text: How then is it that it does rise again? From our exceeding depravity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:147
verses.text: For as long as we abide in the body of Christ, as long as we are united, it rises not again, but lies dead; or rather that former enmity never rises again at all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:148
verses.text: But if we breed another, it is no longer because of Him, who hath destroyed and put to death the former one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:149
verses.text: It is thou, forsooth, that travailest with a fresh one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:150
verses.text: "For the mind of the flesh," saith he, "is enmity against God;" (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:151
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:152
verses.text: ) if we are in nothing carnally-minded, there will be no fresh enmity produced, but that "peace" shall remain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:153
verses.text: Moral.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:154
verses.text: Think then, how vast an evil is it, when God hath employed so many methods to reconcile us, and hath effected it, that we should again fall back into enmity! This enmity no fresh Baptism, but hell itself awaits; no fresh remission, but searching trial.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:155
verses.text: The mind of the flesh is luxury and indolence, the "mind of the flesh" is covetousness and all kinds of sin.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:156
verses.text: Why is it said the mind of the flesh? While yet the flesh could do nothing without the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:157
verses.text: He does not say this to the disparagement of the flesh, any more than when he says the "natural man," ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:158
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:159
verses.text: ) he uses that expression to the disparagement of the soul, for neither body nor soul in itself, if it receive not the impulse which is far above, is able to achieve any thing great or noble.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:160
verses.text: Hence he calls those acts which the soul performs of herself, "natural; ψυχικά" and those which the body performs of itself "carnal".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:161
verses.text: Not because these are natural, but because, inasmuch as they receive not that direction from heaven, they perish.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:162
verses.text: So the eyes are good, but without light, will commit innumerable errors; this, however, is the fault of their weakness, not of nature.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:163
verses.text: Were the errors natural, then should we never be able to use them aright at all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:164
verses.text: For nothing that is natural is evil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:165
verses.text: Why then does he call carnal affections sins? Because whenever the flesh exalts herself, and gets the mastery over her charioteer, she produces ten thousand mischiefs.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:166
verses.text: The virtue of the flesh is, her subjection to the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:167
verses.text: It is her vice to govern the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:168
verses.text: As the horse then may be good and nimble, and yet this is not shown without a rider; so also the flesh will then show her goodness, when we cut off her prancings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:169
verses.text: But neither again is the rider shown, if he have not skill.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:170
verses.text: Nay he himself will do mischief yet more fearful than that before named.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:171
verses.text: So that on all hands we must have the Spirit at hand.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:172
verses.text: This being at hand will impart new strength to the rider; this will give beauty both to body and soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:173
verses.text: For just as the soul, while dwelling in the body, makes it beautiful, but when she leaves it destitute of her own native energy and departs, like a painter confounding his colors together, the greatest loathsomeness ensues, every one of the several parts hastening to corruption, and dissolution:—so is it also when the Spirit forsakes the body and the soul, the loathsomeness which ensues is worse and greater.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:174
verses.text: Do not then, because the body is inferior to the soul, revile it, for neither do I endure to revile the soul because it hath no strength without the Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:175
verses.text: If one need say anything at all, the soul is deserving of the greater censure than the body; for the body indeed can do no grevious harm without the soul, whereas the soul can do much without the body.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:176
verses.text: Because, we know, when the one is even wasting away, and has no wantonness, the soul is busily employed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:177
verses.text: Even as those sorcerers, magicians, envious persons, enchanters, especially cause the body to waste away.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:178
verses.text: But besides this, not even luxury is the effect of the necessity of the body, but rather of the inattentiveness of the soul; for food, not feasting, is the object of the necessity of the body.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:179
verses.text: For if I have a mind to put on a strong curb, I stop the horse; but the body is unable to check the soul in her evil courses.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:180
verses.text: Wherefore then does he call it the carnal mind? Because it comes to be wholly of the flesh, for when she has the mastery, then she goes wrong, as soon as ever she has deprived herself of reason, and of the supremacy of the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:181
verses.text: The virtue therefore of the body consists in this, in its submission to the soul, since of itself the flesh is neither good nor evil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:182
verses.text: For what could the body ever do of itself? It is then by its connection that the body is good, good because of its subjection, but of itself neither good nor evil, with capacity, however, both for one and for the other, and having an equal tendency either way.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:183
verses.text: The body has a natural desire, not however of fornication, nor of adultery, but of pleasure; the body has a desire not of feasting, but of food; not of drunkenness, but of drink.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:184
verses.text: For in proof that it is not drunkenness that is the natural desire of the body, mark how, whenever you exceed the measure, when you go beyond the boundary-lines, it cannot hold out a moment longer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:185
verses.text: Up to this point it is of the body, but all the rest of the excesses, as e.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:186
verses.text: g.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:187
verses.text: , when she is hurried away into sensualities, when she becomes stupefied, these are of the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:188
verses.text: For though the body be good, still it is vastly inferior to the soul, as lead is less of value than gold, and yet gold needs lead to solder it, and just so has the soul need also of the body.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:189
verses.text: Or in the same way as a noble child requires a conductor, so again does the soul stand in need of the body.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:190
verses.text: For, as we speak of childish things, not to the disparagement of childhood, but only of those acts which are done during childhood; so also are we now speaking of the body.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:191
verses.text: Yet it is in our power, if we will, no longer to be in the flesh, no, nor upon the earth, but in heaven, and in the Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:192
verses.text: For our being here or there, is not determined so much by our position, as by our disposition.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:193
verses.text: Of many people, at least, who are in some place, we say they are not there, when we say, "Thou wast not here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:194
verses.text: And again Thou art not here".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:195
verses.text: And why do I say this? We often say, "Thou art not at (ἐν) thyself, I am not at (ἐν) myself," and yet what can be more material (a stronger instance of corporeal locality) than this, that a man is near to himself? And yet, notwithstanding, we say that he is not at himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:196
verses.text: Let us then be in ourselves, in heaven, in the Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 6:197
verses.text: Let us abide in the peace and in the grace of God, that we may be set at liberty from all the things of the flesh, and may be able to attain to those good things which are promised in Jesus Christ our Lord, with whom to the Father, together with the Holy Spirit, be glory, and might, and honor, now and henceforth, and for ever and ever, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:1
verses.text: Homily VI.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:2
verses.text: Chapter II.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:3
verses.text: Verses –  "And He came and preached peace to you that were far off, and peace to them that were nigh, for through Him we both have our access in one Spirit unto the Father.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:4
verses.text: So then ye are no more strangers and sojourners, but ye are fellow-citizens with the saints, and of the household of God, being built upon the foundation of the Apostles and Prophets, Christ Jesus Himself being the chief corner-stone.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:5
verses.text: In whom each several building, fitly framed together, groweth into a holy temple in the Lord.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:6
verses.text: In whom ye also are builded together for a habitation of God in the Spirit".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:7
verses.text: He sent not, saith the Apostle, by the hand of another, nor did He announce these tidings to us by means of any other, but Himself did it in His own person.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:8
verses.text: He sent not Angel nor Archangel on the mission, because to repair so many and vast mischiefs and to declare what had been wrought was in the power of none other, but required His own coming.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:9
verses.text: The Lord then took upon Himself the rank of a servant, nay, almost of a minister, "and came, and preached peace to you," saith he, "that were far off, and to them that were nigh".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:10
verses.text: To the Jews, he means, who as compared with ourselves were nigh.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:11
verses.text: "For through Him we both have our access in one Spirit unto the Father".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:12
verses.text: "Peace," saith he, that "peace" which is towards God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:13
verses.text: He hath reconciled us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:14
verses.text: For the Lord Himself also saith, "Peace I leave with you; my peace I give unto you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:15
verses.text: (John xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:16
verses.text: ) And again, "Be of good cheer, I have overcome the world".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:17
verses.text: (John xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:18
verses.text: ) And again, "Whatsoever ye shall ask in my name that will I do".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:19
verses.text: (John xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:20
verses.text: ) And again, "For the Father loveth you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:21
verses.text: (John xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:22
verses.text: ) These are so many evidences of peace.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:23
verses.text: But how towards the Gentiles? "Because through Him we both have our access in one Spirit unto the Father," not ye less, and they more, but all by one and the same grace.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:24
verses.text: The wrath He appeased by His death, and hath made us meet for the Father's love through the Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:25
verses.text: Mark again, the "in" means "by" or "through".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:26
verses.text: By Himself and the Spirit that is, He hath brought us unto the Father.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:27
verses.text: "So then ye are no more strangers and sojourners, but fellow-citizens with the saints".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:28
verses.text: Perceive ye that it is not with the Jews simply, no, but with those saintly and great men, such as Abraham, and Moses, and Elias? It is for the self-same city with these we are enrolled, for that we declare ourselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:29
verses.text: "For they that say such things," saith he, "make it manifest that they are seeking after a country of their own".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:30
verses.text: (Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:31
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:32
verses.text: ) No longer are we strangers from the saints, nor foreigners.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:33
verses.text: For they who shall not attain to heavenly blessings, are foreigners.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:34
verses.text: "For the Son," saith Christ, "abideth for ever".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:35
verses.text: (John viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:36
verses.text: )  "And of the household," he continues, "of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:37
verses.text: The very thing which they at the first had, by means of so many toils and troubles, hath been for you accomplished by the grace of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:38
verses.text: Behold the hope of your calling.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:39
verses.text: "Being built upon the foundation of the Apostles and Prophets".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:40
verses.text: Observe how he blends all together, the Gentiles, the Jews, the Apostles, the Prophets, and Christ, and illustrates the union sometimes from the body, and sometimes from the building: "built," saith he, "upon the foundation of the Apostles and Prophets;" that is, the Apostles and Prophets are a foundation, and he places the Apostles first, though they are in order of time last, doubtless to represent and express this, that both the one and the other are alike a foundation, and that the whole is one building, and that there is one root.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:41
verses.text: Consider, that the Gentiles have the Patriarchs as a foundation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:42
verses.text: He here speaks more strongly of that point than he does when he speaks of a "grafting in".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:43
verses.text: There he rather attaches them on.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:44
verses.text: Then he adds, that He who binds the whole together in Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:45
verses.text: For the chief corner-stone binds together both the walls, and the foundations.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:46
verses.text: "In whom each several building".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:47
verses.text: Mark, how he knits it all together, and represents Him at one time, as holding down the whole body from above, and welding it together; at another time, as supporting the building from below, and being, as it were, a root, or base.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:48
verses.text: And whereas he had used the expression, "He created in Himself of the twain one new man;" (Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:49
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:50
verses.text: ) by this he clearly shows us, that by Himself Christ knits together the two walls: and again, that in Him it was created.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:51
verses.text: And "He is the first-born," saith he, "of all creation," that is, He Himself supports all things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:52
verses.text: "In whom each several building, fitly framed together".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:53
verses.text: Whether you speak of the roof, or of the walls, or of any other part whatsoever, He it is supports the whole.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:54
verses.text: Thus he elsewhere calls Him a foundation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:55
verses.text: "For other foundations," saith he, "can no man lay than that which is laid, which is Jesus Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:56
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:57
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:58
verses.text: ) "In whom each several building," he saith, "fitly framed together".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:59
verses.text: Here he displays the perfectness of it, and indicates that one cannot otherwise have place in it, unless by living with great exactness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:60
verses.text: "It groweth saith he into a holy temple in the Lord, in whom ye also," he adds, "are builded together".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:61
verses.text: He is speaking continuously: "Into a holy temple, for a habitation of God in the Spirit".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:62
verses.text: What then is the object of this building? It is that God may dwell in this temple.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:63
verses.text: For each of you severally is a temple, and all of you together are a temple.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:64
verses.text: And He dwelleth in you as in the body of Christ, and as in a Spiritual temple.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:65
verses.text: He does not use the word which means our coming to God, (πρόσοδος) but which implies God's bringing us to Himself, (προσαγωγή) for we came not out of ourselves, but we were brought nigh by Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:66
verses.text: "No one," saith Christ, "cometh unto the Father but by Me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:67
verses.text: And again, "I am the way, and the truth, and the life".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:68
verses.text: (John xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:69
verses.text: )  He joins them with the Saints and again returns to his former image, nowhere suffering them to be disunited from Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:70
verses.text: Doubtless then, this is a building that shall go on until His coming.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:71
verses.text: Doubtless it was for this reason that Paul said, "As a wise master builder, I laid a foundation".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:72
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:73
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:75
verses.text: ) And again that Christ is the foundation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:76
verses.text: What then means all this? You observe that the comparisons have all referred to the subject-matters, and that we must not expound them to the very letter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:77
verses.text: The Apostle speaks from analogy as Christ does, where He calls the Father an husbandman, (John xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:78
verses.text: ) and Himself a root.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:79
verses.text: (Rev.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:80
verses.text: xxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:81
verses.text: )  Chap.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:82
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:83
verses.text: ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:84
verses.text: "For this cause I Paul, the prisoner of Christ Jesus in behalf of you Gentiles".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:85
verses.text: He has mentioned Christ's great and affectionate care; he now passes on to his own, insignificant indeed as it is, and a very nothing in comparison with that, and yet this is enough to engage them to himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:86
verses.text: For this cause, saith he, am I also bound.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:87
verses.text: For if my Lord was crucified for your sakes, much more am I bound.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:88
verses.text: He not only was bound Himself, but allows His servants to be bound also,—"for you Gentiles".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:89
verses.text: It is full of emphasis; not only do we no longer loathe you, but we are even bound, saith he, for your sakes and of this exceeding grace am I partaker.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:90
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:91
verses.text: "If so be that ye have heard of the dispensation of that grace of God, which was given me to you-ward".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:92
verses.text: He alludes to the prediction addressed to Ananias concerning him at Damascus, when the Lord said, "Go thy way, for he is a chosen vessel unto Me, to bear My name before the Gentiles and Kings".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:93
verses.text: (Acts ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:94
verses.text: )  By "dispensation of grace," he means the revelation made to him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:95
verses.text: As much as to say, "I learned it not from man.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:96
verses.text: (Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:97
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:98
verses.text: ) He vouchsafed to reveal it even to me, though but an individual for your sakes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:99
verses.text: For Himself said unto me, saith he, "Depart, for I will send thee forth far hence unto the Gentiles".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:100
verses.text: (Acts xxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:101
verses.text: ) "If so be that ye have heard" for a dispensation it was, a mighty one; to call one, uninfluenced from any other quarter, immediately from above, and to say, "Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou Me?" and to strike him blind with that ineffable light! "if so be that ye have heard," saith he, "of the dispensation of that grace of God which was given me to you-ward".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:102
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:103
verses.text: "How that by revelation was made known unto me the mystery, as I wrote afore in few words".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:104
verses.text: Perhaps he had informed them of it by some persons, or had not long before been writing to them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:105
verses.text: Here he is pointing out that the whole is of God, that we have contributed nothing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:106
verses.text: For what? I ask, was not Paul himself, the wonderful, he that was so versed in the law, he that was brought up at the feet of Gamaliel according to the most perfect manner, was not he saved by grace? With good reason too does he call this a mystery, for a mystery it is, to raise the Gentiles in a moment to a higher rank than the Jews.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:107
verses.text: "As I wrote afore," saith he, "in few words," i-e:, briefly,  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:108
verses.text: "Whereby, when ye read, ye can perceive".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:109
verses.text: Amazing! So then he wrote not the whole, nor so much as he should have written.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:110
verses.text: But here the nature of the subject prevented it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:111
verses.text: Elsewhere, as in the case of the Hebrews (Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:112
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:113
verses.text: ) and the Corinthians, ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:114
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:115
verses.text: ) the incapacity of the hearers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:116
verses.text: "Whereby, when ye read, ye can perceive," saith he, "my understanding in the mystery of Christ," i-e:, how I knew, how I understood either such things as God hath spoken, or else, that Christ sitteth at the right hand of God; and then too the dignity, in that God "hath not dealt so with any nation".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:117
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:118
verses.text: cxlvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:119
verses.text: ) And then to explain what nation this is with whom God hath thus dealt, he adds,  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:120
verses.text: "Which in other generations was not made known unto the sons of men, as it hath now been revealed unto His holy Apostles and Prophets in the Spirit".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:121
verses.text: What then, tell me, did not the Prophets know it? How then doth Christ say, that Moses and the Prophets wrote "these things concerning Me?" And again, "If ye believed Moses, ye would believe Me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:122
verses.text: (John v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:123
verses.text: ) And again, "Ye search the Scriptures, because ye think that in them ye have eternal life, and these are they which bear witness of me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:124
verses.text: (John v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:125
verses.text: ) His meaning is this, either that it was not revealed unto all men, for he adds, "which in other generations was not made known unto the sons of men, as it hath now been revealed;" or else, that it was not thus made known by the very facts and realities themselves, "as it hath now been revealed unto His holy Apostles and Prophets in the Spirit".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:126
verses.text: For reflect.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:127
verses.text: Peter, had he not been instructed by the Spirit, never would have gone to the Gentiles.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:128
verses.text: For hear what he says, "Then hath God given unto them the Holy Ghost, as well as unto us".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:129
verses.text: (Acts x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:130
verses.text: ) That it was by the Spirit that God chose that they should receive the grace.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:131
verses.text: The Prophets then spoke, yet they knew it not thus perfectly; so far from it, that not even did the Apostles, after they had heard it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:132
verses.text: So far did it surpass all human calculation, and the common expectation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:133
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:134
verses.text: "That the Gentiles are fellow-heirs, and fellow-members of the body and fellow partakers".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:135
verses.text: What is this; "fellow-heirs, and fellow-partakers of the promise, and fellow-members of the body?" This last is the great thing, that they should be one body; this exceeding closeness of relation to Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:136
verses.text: For that they were to be called indeed, that they knew, but that it was so great, as yet they knew not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:137
verses.text: This therefore he calls the mystery.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:138
verses.text: "Of the promise".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:139
verses.text: The Israelites were partakers, and the Gentiles also were fellow-partakers of the promise of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:140
verses.text: "In Christ Jesus through the Gospel".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:141
verses.text: That is, by His being sent unto them also, and by their believing; for it is not said they are fellow-heirs simply, but "through the Gospel".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:142
verses.text: However, this indeed, is nothing so great, it is in fact a small thing, and it discloses to us another and greater thing, that not only men knew not this, but that neither Angels nor Archangels, nor any other created power, knew it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:143
verses.text: For it was a mystery, and was not revealed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:144
verses.text: "That ye can perceive," he saith, "my understanding".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:145
verses.text: This alludes, perhaps, to what he said to them in the Acts, that he had some knowledge that the Gentiles also were called.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:146
verses.text: This, he says, is his own knowledge, "the knowledge of the mystery," which he had mentioned, viz.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:147
verses.text: , "that Christ will in Himself make of the twain one new man".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:148
verses.text: For by revelation he was instructed, both he and Peter, that they must not spurn the Gentiles; and this he states in his defence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:149
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:150
verses.text: "Whereof I was made a minister, according to the gift of that grace of God which was given me according to the working of His power".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:151
verses.text: He had said, "I am a prisoner;" but now again he says, that all is of God, as he says, "according to the gift of His grace;" for according to the power of the gift is the dignity of this privilege.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:152
verses.text: But the gift would not have been enough, had it not also implanted in him power.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:153
verses.text: Moral.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:154
verses.text: For a work indeed it was of power, of mighty power, and such as no human diligence was equal to.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:155
verses.text: For he brought three qualifications to the preaching of the word, a zeal fervent and venturous, a soul ready to undergo any possible hardship, and knowledge and wisdom combined.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:156
verses.text: For his love of enterprise, his blamelessness of life, had availed nothing, had he not also received the power of the Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:157
verses.text: And look at it as seen first in himself, or rather hear his own words.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:158
verses.text: "That our ministration be not blamed".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:159
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:160
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:161
verses.text: ) And again, "For our exhortation, is not of error, nor of uncleanness, nor in guile, nor a cloke of covetousness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:162
verses.text: ( Thes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:163
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:165
verses.text: ) Thus thou hast seen his blamelessness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:166
verses.text: And again, "For we take thought for things honorable, not only in the sight of the Lord, but also in the sight of men".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:167
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:168
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:169
verses.text: ) Then again, besides these; "I protest by that glorying in you which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord, I die daily".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:170
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:171
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:172
verses.text: ) And again; "Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? shall tribulation, or anguish, or persecution?" (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:173
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:174
verses.text: ) And again; "In much patience, in afflictions, in necessities, in distresses, in stripes, in imprisonments, in watchings".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:175
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:176
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:178
verses.text: ) Then again, his prudence and management; "To the Jews I became as a Jew, to them that are without law as without law, to them that are under the law as under the law".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:179
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:180
verses.text: ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:181
verses.text: ) He shaves his head also, (Acts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:182
verses.text: xxi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:184
verses.text: ) and does numberless things of the sort.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:185
verses.text: But the crown of all is in the power of the Holy Ghost.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:186
verses.text: "For I will not dare to speak," saith he, "of any things save those which Christ wrought through me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:187
verses.text: (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:188
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:189
verses.text: ) And again, "For what is there wherein you were made inferior to the rest of the Churches?" ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:190
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:191
verses.text: ) And again, "For in nothing was I behind the very chiefest Apostles though I am nothing".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:192
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:193
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:194
verses.text: ) Without these things, the work had been impossible.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:195
verses.text: It was not then by his miracles that men were made believers; no, it was not the miracles that did this, nor was it upon the ground of these that he claimed his high pretension, but upon those other grounds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:196
verses.text: For a man must be alike irreproachable in conduct, prudent and discreet in his dealings with others, regardless of danger, and apt to teach.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:197
verses.text: It was by these qualifications that the greater part of his success was achieved.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:198
verses.text: Where there were these, there was no need of miracles.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:199
verses.text: At least we see he was successful in numberless such cases, quite antecedently to the use of miracles.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:200
verses.text: But, now-a-days, we without any of these would fain command all things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:201
verses.text: Yet if one of them be separated from the other, it henceforth becomes useless.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:202
verses.text: What is the advantage of a man's being ever so regardless of danger, if his life be open to censure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:203
verses.text: "For if the light that is in thee be darkness," saith Christ, "how great is that darkness?" (Mat.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:204
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:205
verses.text: ) Again, what the advantage of a man's being of an irreproachable life, if he is sluggish and indolent? "For, he that doth not take his cross, and follow after Me," saith He, "is not worthy of Me;" (Mat.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:206
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:207
verses.text: ) and so, "The good shepherd layeth down his life for the sheep".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:208
verses.text: (John x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:209
verses.text: ) Again, what is the advantage of being both these, unless a man is at the same time prudent and discreet in "knowing how he ought to answer each one?" (Col.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:210
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:211
verses.text: ) Even if miracles be not in our power, yet both these qualities are in our power.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:212
verses.text: Still however, notwithstanding Paul contributed so much from himself, yet did he attribute all to grace.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:213
verses.text: This is the act of a grateful servant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:214
verses.text: And we should never so much as have heard of his good deeds, had he not been brought to a necessity of declaring them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:215
verses.text: And are we worthy then so much as even to mention the name of Paul? He, who had moreover grace to aid him, yet was not satisfied, but contributed to the work ten thousand perils; whilst we, who are destitute of that source of confidence, whence, tell me, do we expect either to preserve those who are committed to our charge, or to gain those who are not come to the fold;—men, as we are, who have been making a study of self-indulgence, who are searching the world over for ease, and who are unable, or rather who are unwilling, to endure even the very shadow of danger, and are as far distant from his wisdom as heaven is from earth? Hence it is too that they who are under us are at so great a distance behind the men of those days; because the disciples of those days were better than the teachers of these, isolated as they were in the midst of the populace, and of tyrants, and having all men on all sides their enemies, and yet not in the slightest degree dragged down or yielding.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:216
verses.text: Hear at least what he saith to the Philippians, (Philip.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:217
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:218
verses.text: ) "Because to you it hath been granted in the behalf of Christ, not only to believe on Him, but also to suffer in his behalf".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:219
verses.text: And again to the Thessalonians, ( Thes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:220
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:221
verses.text: ) "For ye, brethren, became imitators of the churches of God which are in Judaea".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:222
verses.text: And again in writing to the Hebrews (Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:223
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:224
verses.text: ) he said, "And ye took joyfully the spoiling of your possessions".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:225
verses.text: And to the Colossians (Col.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:226
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:227
verses.text: ) he testifies, saying, "For ye died, and your life is hid with Christ in God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:228
verses.text: And indeed to these very Ephesians he bears witness of many perils and dangers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:229
verses.text: And again in writing to the Galatians, (Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:230
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:231
verses.text: ) he says, "Did ye suffer so many things in vain? if it be indeed in vain".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:232
verses.text: And you see them too, all employed in doing good.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:233
verses.text: Hence it was that both grace wrought effectually in those days, hence also that they lived in good works.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:234
verses.text: Hear, moreover, what he writes to the Corinthians, against whom he brings charges out of number; yet does he not bear even them record, where he says, "Yea, what zeal it wrought in you, yea, what longing!" ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:235
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:236
verses.text: ) And again, in how many points does he bear them record on this subject? These things one shall not see now-a-days, even in teachers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:237
verses.text: They are all gone and perished.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:238
verses.text: And the cause is, that love hath waxed cold, that sinners go unpunished; (for hear what he says writing to Timothy, ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:239
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:240
verses.text: ) "Them that sin, reprove in the sight of all;") it is that the rulers are in a sickly state; for if the head be not sound, how can the rest of the body maintain its vigor? But mark how great is the present disorder.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:241
verses.text: They, who were living virtuously, and who under any circumstance might have confidence, have taken possession of the tops of the mountains, and have escaped out of the world, separating themselves as from an enemy and an alien and not from a body to which they belonged.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:242
verses.text: Plagues too, teeming with untold mischiefs, have lighted upon the Churches.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:243
verses.text: The chief offices have become saleable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:244
verses.text: Hence numberless evils are springing, and there is no one to redress, no one to reprove them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:245
verses.text: Nay, the disorder has assumed a sort of method and consistency.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:246
verses.text: Has a man done wrong, and been arraigned for it? His effort is not to prove himself guiltless, but to find if possible accomplices in his crimes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:247
verses.text: What is to become of us? since hell is our threatened portion.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:248
verses.text: Believe me, had not God stored up punishment for us there, ye would see every day tragedies deeper than the disasters of the Jews.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:249
verses.text: What then? however let no one take offence, for I mention no names; suppose some one were to come into this church to present you that are here at this moment, those that are now with me, and to make inquisition of them; or rather not now, but suppose on Easter day any one, endued with such a spirit, as to have a thorough knowledge of the things they had been doing, should narrowly examine all that came to Communion, and were being washed in Baptism after they had attended the mysteries; many things would be discovered more shocking than the Jewish horrors.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:250
verses.text: He would find persons who practise augury, who make use of charms, and omens and incantations, and who have committed fornication, adulterers, drunkards, and revilers,—covetous, I am unwilling to add, lest I should hurt the feelings of any of those who are standing here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:251
verses.text: What more? Suppose any one should make scrutiny into all the communicants in the world, what kind of transgression is there which he would not detect? and what if he examined those in authority? Would he not find them eagerly bent upon gain? making traffic of high places? envious, malignant, vainglorious, gluttonous, and slaves to money?  Where then there is such impiety as this going on, what dreadful calamity must we not expect? And to be assured how sore vengeance they incur who are guilty of such sins as these, consider the examples of old.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:252
verses.text: One single man, a common soldier, stole the sacred property, and all were smitten.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:253
verses.text: Ye know, doubtless, the history I mean? I am speaking of Acham the son of Carmi, the man who stole the consecrated spoil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:254
verses.text: (Joshua vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:256
verses.text: ) The time too when the Prophet spoke, was a time when their country was full of soothsayers, like that of the Philistines.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:257
verses.text: (Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:258
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:259
verses.text: ) Whereas now there are evils out of number at the full, and not one fears.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:260
verses.text: Oh, henceforth let us take the alarm.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:261
verses.text: God is accustomed to punish the righteous also with the wicked; such was the case with Daniel, and with the three holy Children, such has been the case with ten thousand others, such is the case in the wars that are taking place even at the present day.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:262
verses.text: For the one indeed, whatever burden of sins they have upon them, by this means lay aside even that; but not so the other.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:263
verses.text: On account of all these things, let us take heed to ourselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:264
verses.text: Do ye not see these wars? Do ye not hear of these disasters? Do ye learn no lesson from these things? Nations and whole cities are swallowed up and destroyed, and myriads as many again are enslaved to the barbarians.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:265
verses.text: If hell bring us not to our senses, yet let these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:266
verses.text: What, are these too mere threats, are they not facts that have already taken place? Great is the punishment they have suffered, yet a greater still shall we suffer, who are not brought to our senses even by their fate.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:267
verses.text: Is this discourse wearing? I am aware it is myself, but if we attend to it, it has its advantage; because this it has not, the quality of an address to please,—nay more, nor ever shall have, but ever those topics which may avail to humble and to chasten the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 7:268
verses.text: For these will be to us the ground-work of those blessings to come hereafter, to which God grant that we may all attain, in Jesus Christ our Lord, with whom to the Father, together with the Holy Ghost be glory and might and honor, now and henceforth, and forever and ever, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:1
verses.text: Homily VII.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:2
verses.text: Chapter III.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:3
verses.text: Verses –  "Unto me, who am less than the least of all saints, was this grace given, to preach unto the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ; and to make all men see what is the dispensation of the mystery, which from all ages hath been hid in God, who created all things:to the intent that now unto the principalities and the powers in the heavenly places might be made known through the Church the manifold wisdom of God, according to the eternal purpose, which He purposed in Christ Jesus our Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:4
verses.text: They who go to the physician's have not merely to go there and nothing further; they have to learn how to treat themselves, and to apply remedies.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:5
verses.text: And so with us then who come here, we must not do this and nothing else, we must learn our lesson, the surpassing lowliness of Paul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:6
verses.text: What? when he was about to speak of the vastness of the grace of God, hear what he saith, "Unto me, who am less than the least of all saints, was this grace given".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:7
verses.text: Lowliness indeed it was even to bewail his former sins, although blotted out, and to make mention of them, and to hold himself within his true measure as where he calls himself "a blasphemer, and a persecutor, and injurious;" ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:8
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:9
verses.text: ) yet nothing was equal to this: for "formerly," saith he, such was I; and again he calls himself, "one born out of due time".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:10
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:11
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:12
verses.text: ) But that after so many great and good deeds and at that time he should thus humble himself, and call himself "less than the least of all," this is indeed great and surpassing moderation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:13
verses.text: "To one who am less than the least of all saints;" he saith not, "than the Apostles".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:14
verses.text: So that that expression is less strong than this before us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:15
verses.text: There his words are, "I am not meet to be called an Apostle".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:16
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:17
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:18
verses.text: ) Here he says that he is even "less than the least of all saints;" "to me," saith he, "who am less than the least of all saints was this grace given".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:19
verses.text: What grace? "To preach unto the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ, and to make all men see what is the dispensation of the mystery, which from all ages hath been hid in God, who created all things, to the intent that now unto the principalities and the powers in the heavenly places, might be made known through the Church the manifold wisdom of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:20
verses.text: True, to man it was not revealed; and art thou enlightening Angels and Archangels and Principalities and Powers? I am, saith he.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:21
verses.text: For it was "hid in God," even "in God who created all things".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:22
verses.text: And dost thou venture to utter this? I do, saith he.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:23
verses.text: But whence hath this been made manifest to the Angels? By the Church.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:24
verses.text: Again he saith, not merely the manifold (ποικίλος) but the much-manifold (πολυποίκιλος) wisdom, that is, "the multiplied and varied".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:25
verses.text: What then is this? Did not Angels know it? No, nothing of it; for if Principalities knew it not, much less could Angels ever have known it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:26
verses.text: What then? Did not even Archangels know it? No, nor even they.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:27
verses.text: But whence were they going to know it? Who was to reveal it? When we were taught it, then were they also by us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:28
verses.text: For hear what the Angel saith to Joseph; "Thou shalt call His Name Jesus, for it is He that shall save His people from their sins".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:29
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:30
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:31
verses.text: )  Paul himself was sent to the Gentiles, the other Apostles to the Circumcision.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:32
verses.text: So that the more marvellous and astonishing commission was given, saith he, "to me, who am less than the least".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:33
verses.text: And this too was of grace, that he that was least should have the greatest things entrusted to him; that he should be made the herald of these tidings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:34
verses.text: For he that is made a herald of the greater tidings, is in this way great.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:35
verses.text: "To preach unto the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:36
verses.text: If His "riches are unsearchable," and that too after his appearing, much more is His essence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:37
verses.text: If it is still a mystery, much more was it before it was made known; for a mystery he calls it on this account, because neither did the Angels know it, nor was it manifest to any one else.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:38
verses.text: "And to make all men see," saith he, "what is the dispensation of the mystery which from all ages hath been hid in God, who created all things".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:39
verses.text: Angels knew only this, that "The Lord's portion was His people".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:40
verses.text: (Deut.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:41
verses.text: xxxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:43
verses.text: ) And again it is said, "The Prince of Persia withstood me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:44
verses.text: (Dan.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:45
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:46
verses.text: ) So that it is nothing to be wondered at that they were ignorant of this; for if they were ignorant of the circumstances of the return from the Captivity, much more would they be of these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:47
verses.text: For this is the gospel.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:48
verses.text: "It is He that shall save," it saith, "His people".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:49
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:50
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:51
verses.text: ) Not a word about the Gentiles.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:52
verses.text: But what concerns the Gentiles the Spirit revealeth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:53
verses.text: That they were called indeed, the Angels knew, but that it was to the same privileges as Israel, yea, even to sit upon the throne of God, this, who would ever have expected? who would ever have believed?  "Which hath been hid," saith he, "in God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:54
verses.text: This "dispensation," however, he more clearly unfolds in the Epistle to the Romans.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:55
verses.text: "In God," he continues, "who created all things by Jesus Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:56
verses.text: And he does well to say "by Jesus Christ;" forasmuch as He who created all things by Him, revealeth also this by Him; for He hath made nothing without Him; for "without Him," it is said, "was not any thing made".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:57
verses.text: (John i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:58
verses.text: )  In speaking of "principalities" and "powers," he speaks both of those above and those beneath.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:59
verses.text: "According to the eternal purpose".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:60
verses.text: It hath been now, he means, brought to pass, but not now decreed, it had been planned beforehand from the very first.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:61
verses.text: "According to the eternal purpose which He purposed in Christ Jesus our Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:62
verses.text: That is, according to the eternal foreknowledge; foreknowing the things to come, i-e:, he means the ages to come; for He knew what was to be, and thus decreed it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:63
verses.text: According to the purpose of the ages, of those, perhaps, which He hath made by Christ Jesus, because it was by Christ that every thing was made.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:64
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:65
verses.text: "In whom we have," saith he, "boldness, and access in confidence through our faith in him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:66
verses.text: "Have access," not as prisoners, he says, nor yet, as persons candidates for pardon, nor as sinners; for, saith he, we have even "boldness with confidence," that is, accompanied with cheerful trust; arising from what source? "through our faith in Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:67
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:68
verses.text: "Wherefore I ask that ye faint not at my tribulations for you, which are your glory".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:69
verses.text: How is it "for them?" How is it "their glory?" It is because God so loved them, as to give even the Son for them, and to afflict His servants for them: for it was in order that they might attain so many blessings, that Paul was in prison.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:70
verses.text: Surely this was from God's exceeding love towards them: it is what God also saith concerning the Prophets, "I have slain them by the words of my mouth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:71
verses.text: (Hos.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:72
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:73
verses.text: ) But how was it that they fainted, when another was afflicted? He means, they were troubled, were distressed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:74
verses.text: This also he says when writing to the Thessalonians, "that no man be moved by these afflictions".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:75
verses.text: ( Thes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:76
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:77
verses.text: ) For not only ought we not to grieve, but we ought even to rejoice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:78
verses.text: If ye find consolation in the forewarning, we tell you beforehand that here we have tribulation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:79
verses.text: And why pray? Because thus hath the Lord ordered.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:80
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:82
verses.text: "For this cause I bow my knees unto the Father from whom every family in heaven and on earth is named".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:83
verses.text: He here shows the spirit of his prayer for them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:84
verses.text: He does not say simply, "I pray," but manifests the supplication to be heartfelt, by the "bowing of the knees".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:85
verses.text: "From whom every family".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:86
verses.text: That is, no longer, he means, reckoned, according to the number of Angels, but according to Him who hath created the tribes both in heaven above and in earth beneath, not as the Jewish.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:87
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:89
verses.text: "That He would grant you according to the riches of His glory that ye may be strengthened with power through His Spirit in the inward man; that Christ may dwell in your hearts through faith".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:90
verses.text: Mark with what insatiable earnestness he invokes these blessings upon them, that they may not be tossed about.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:91
verses.text: But how shall this be effected? By the "Holy Spirit in your inward man, that Christ may dwell in your hearts through faith".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:92
verses.text: How again shall this be?  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:94
verses.text: "To the end that ye being rooted and grounded in love, may be strong to apprehend with all the saints, what is the breadth, and length, and height, and depth, and to know the love of Christ which passeth knowledge".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:95
verses.text: Thus is his prayer now again, the very same as when he began.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:96
verses.text: For what were his words in the beginning? "That the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory may give unto you a Spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of Him; having the eyes of your heart enlightened, that ye may know what is the hope of His calling, what the riches of the glory of His inheritance in the saints; and what the exceeding greatness of His power to us-ward who believe".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:97
verses.text: And now again he says the same.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:98
verses.text: "That ye may be strong to apprehend with all the saints what is the breadth, and length, and height, and depth;" i-e:, to know perfectly the mystery which hath been providentially ordered in our behalf: "and the breadth, and length, and height, and depth;" that is, too, the immensity of the love of God, and how it extends every where.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:99
verses.text: And he outlines it by the visible dimensions of solid bodies, pointing as it were to a man.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:100
verses.text: He comprehends the upper and under and sides.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:101
verses.text: I have thus spoken indeed, he would say, yet is it not for any words of mine to teach you these things; that must be the work of the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:102
verses.text: "By His might," saith he, is it that ye must be "strengthened" against the trials that await you, and in order to remain unshaken; so that there is no other way to be strengthened but by the Holy Ghost, both on account of trials and carnal reasonings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:103
verses.text: But how doth Christ dwell in the hearts? Hear what Christ Himself saith, "I and my Father will come unto him, and make our abode with him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:104
verses.text: (John xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:105
verses.text: ) He dwelleth in those hearts that are faithful, in those that are "rooted" in His love, those that remain firm and unshaken.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:106
verses.text: "That ye may be" thoroughly "strong," saith he; so that there is great strength needed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:107
verses.text: "That ye may be filled unto all the fulness of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:108
verses.text: What he means is this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:109
verses.text: Although the love of Christ lies above the reach of all human knowledge, yet shall ye know it, if ye shall have Christ dwelling in you, yea, not only shall know from Him this, but shall even "be filled unto all the fulness of God;" meaning by the "fulness of God," either the knowledge how God is worshipped in the Father, the Son, and the Holy Ghost, or else urging them thus to use every effort, in order to be filled with all virtue, of which God is full.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:110
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:111
verses.text: "Now unto Him that is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that worketh in us".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:112
verses.text: That God hath done "abundantly above all that we ask or think," is evident from what the Apostle himself hath written.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:113
verses.text: For I indeed, saith he, pray, but He of Himself, even without any prayer of mine, will do works greater than all we ask, not simply "greater," nor "abundantly greater," but "exceeding abundantly".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:114
verses.text: And this is evident from "the power, that worketh in us:" for neither did we ever ask these things, nor did we expect them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:115
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:116
verses.text: "Unto Him be the glory," he concludes, "in the Church and in Christ Jesus, unto all generations forever and ever, Amen".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:117
verses.text: Well does he close the discourse with prayer and doxology; for right were it that He, who hath bestowed upon us such vast gifts, should be glorified and blessed, so that this is even a proper part of our amazement at His mercies, to give glory for the things advanced to us at God's hands through Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:118
verses.text: "The glory in the Church".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:119
verses.text: Well might he say this, forasmuch as the Church alone can last on to eternity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:120
verses.text: It seems necessary to state what are meant by "families".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:121
verses.text: (πατριαί) Here on earth, indeed there are "families" that is races sprung from one parent stock; but in heaven how can this be, where none is born of another? Surely then, by "families," he means either the assemblies and orders of heavenly beings; as also we find it written in Scripture, "the family of Amattari:" ( Sam.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:122
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:123
verses.text: See Septuagint.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:124
verses.text: ) or else that it is from Him from whom earthly fathers have their name of father.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:125
verses.text: However, he does not ask the whole of God, but demands of them also faith and love, and not simply love, but love "rooted and grounded," so that neither any blasts can shake it, nor any thing else overturn it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:126
verses.text: He had said, that "tribulations" are "glory," and if mine are so to you, he would say, much more will your own be: so that to be afflicted is no token of men being forsaken, for He who hath wrought so great things for us, never would do this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:127
verses.text: Again, if in order to understand the love of God, it was necessary for Paul to pray, and there was need of the indwelling of the Holy Spirit, who by following mere reasonings shall understand the nature of Christ? And why is it a difficult thing to learn that God loveth us? Beloved, it is extremely difficult.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 8:128
