verses.text: And then, as I was fain to tell you, the king beheld them loose, and fell down before them: he heard them singing their song of praise, and beheld four walking, and he called them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:386
verses.text: As Paul, though able to do so, came not forth, until he who had cast him in, called him, and brought him forth: so neither did the three Children come forth, until he who had cast them in commanded them to come forth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:387
verses.text: What lesson are we taught from this? Not to be over hasty in courting persecution, nor when in tribulation to be over eager for deliverance, and on the other hand when they release us not to continue in it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:388
verses.text: Further, the jailor, inasmuch as he was able to enter in where the saints were, fell down at their feet.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:389
verses.text: The king came but to the door and fell down.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:390
verses.text: He dared not approach into the prison which he had prepared for them in the fire.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:391
verses.text: And now mark their words.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:392
verses.text: The one cried, "Sirs, what must I do to be saved?" (Acts xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:393
verses.text: ) The other, though not indeed with so great humility, yet uttered a voice no less sweet, "Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, ye servants of the most high God, come forth, and come hither".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:394
verses.text: (Dan.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:395
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:396
verses.text: ) Mighty dignity! "Ye servants of the most high God, come forth, and come hither".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:397
verses.text: How are they to come forth, O king? Thou didst cast them into the fire bound; they have continued this long time in the fire.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:398
verses.text: Why, had they been made of adamant, had they been blocks of metal, in singing that entire hymn, must they not have perished? On this account then they were saved, because they sang praises to God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:399
verses.text: The fire reverenced their readiness to suffer and afterwards it reverenced that wonderful song, and their hymns of praise.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:400
verses.text: By what title dost thou call them? I said before, "Ye servants of the most high God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:401
verses.text: Yes, to the servants of God, all things are possible; for if some, who are the servants of men, have, nevertheless, power, and authority, and the disposal of their concerns, much more have the servants of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:402
verses.text: He called them by the name most delightful to them, he knew that by this means he flattered them most: for indeed, if it was in order to continue servants of God, that they entered into the fire, there could be no sound more delightful to them than this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:403
verses.text: Had he called them kings, had he called them lords of the world, yet would he not so truly have rejoiced them as when he said, "Ye servants of the most high God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:404
verses.text: And why marvel at this? when, in writing to the mighty city, to her who was mistress of the world, and prided herself upon her high dignities, Paul set down as equivalent in dignity, nay, as far greater, yea incomparably greater than consulship, or kingly name, or than the empire of the world, this title, "Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:405
verses.text: (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:406
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:407
verses.text: ) "Ye servants of the most high God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:408
verses.text: "Yes," he would say, "if they show so great zeal as to be bond-servants, doubtless this is the title by which we shall conciliate them".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:409
verses.text: Again, observe also the piety of the Children: they showed no indignation, no anger, no gain-saying, but they came forth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:410
verses.text: Had they regarded it as an act of vengeance that they had been thrown into the furnace, they would have been grieved against the man who had cast them in; as it is, there is nothing of the kind; but, as though they were going forth from Heaven itself, so went they forth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:411
verses.text: And what the Prophet says of the Sun, that "He is as a bridegroom coming forth out of his chamber," (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:412
verses.text: xix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:413
verses.text: ) one would not go amiss in saying also of them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:414
verses.text: But though he goes forth thus, yet came they forth there more gloriously than he, for he indeed comes forth to enlighten the world with natural light, they to enlighten the world in a different way, I mean, spiritually.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:415
verses.text: For because of them the king straightway issued a decree, containing these words, "It hath seemed good unto me to show the signs and wonders that the Most High God hath wrought toward me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:416
verses.text: How great are His signs! And how mighty are His wonders!" (Dan.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:417
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:419
verses.text: ) So that they went forth, shedding a yet more glorious radiance, beaming indeed in that region itself, but, what is more than all, capable, by means of the king's writings, of being diffused over the world and thus of dispelling the darkness which every where prevails.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:420
verses.text: "Come forth," said he, "and come hither".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:421
verses.text: He gave no commandment to extinguish the flame, but hereby most especially honored them, by believing that they were able not only to walk within it, but even to come out of it while it was still burning.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:422
verses.text: But let us look again, if it seem good to you, at the words of the jailor, "Sirs, what must I do to be saved?" What language sweeter than this? This makes the very Angels leap for joy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:423
verses.text: To hear this language, even the Only-begotten Son of God Himself became a servant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:424
verses.text: This language they who believed at the beginning addressed to Peter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:425
verses.text: (Acts ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:426
verses.text: ) "What shall we do?" And what said he in answer? "Repent and be baptized".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:427
verses.text: To have heard this language from the Jews, gladly would Paul have been cast even in to hell, in his eagerness for their salvation and obedience.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:428
verses.text: But observe, he commits the whole matter to them, he wastes no unnecessary pains.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:429
verses.text: Let us however look at the next point.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:430
verses.text: The king here does not say, What must I do to be saved? but the teaching is plainer in his case than any language whatever; for he straightway becomes a preacher, he needs not to be instructed like the jailor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:431
verses.text: He proclaims God, and makes confession of His power.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:432
verses.text: "Of a truth your God is the God of Gods and the Lord of Kings, because He hath sent His Angel, and hath delivered you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:433
verses.text: (Dan.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:434
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:435
verses.text: ; iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:436
verses.text: ) And what was the sequel? Not one single jailor, but numbers are instructed by the king's writings, by the sight of the facts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:437
verses.text: For that the king would not have told a falsehood is evident enough to every one, because he never would have chosen to bear such testimony to captives, nor to overthrow his own acts; he never would have chosen to incur the imputation of such utter madness: so that had not the truth been abundantly manifest, he would not have written in such terms, and with so many persons present.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:438
verses.text: Perceive ye how great is the power of bonds? How great the force of those praises that are sung in tribulation? Their heart failed not, they were not cast down, but were then yet more vigorous, and their courage then yet greater and justly so.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:439
verses.text: While we are considering these things one question yet remains for us: Why was it that in the prison on the one hand, the prisoners were loosed, whilst in the furnace the executioners were burnt to death: for that indeed should have been the king's fate, because neither were they who bound them, nor they who cast them into the furnace, guilty of so great sin as the man who commanded this should be done.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:440
verses.text: Why then did they perish? On this point there is not any very great need of minute examination; for they were wicked men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:441
verses.text: And therefore this was providentially ordered, that the power of the fire might be shown, and the miracle might be made more signal; for if it thus devoured them that were without, how did it show them unscathed that were within it? it was that the power of God might be made manifest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:442
verses.text: And let no one wonder that I have put the king on a level with the jailor, for he did the same thing; the one was in no wise more noble than the other, and they both had their reward.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:443
verses.text: But, as I said, the righteous, when they are in tribulations, are then especially more energetic, and when they are in bonds: for to suffer any thing for Christ's sake is the sweetest of all consolation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:444
verses.text: Will ye that I remind you of yet another prison? It seems necessary to go on from this chain to another prison still.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:445
verses.text: And which will ye? Shall it be that of Jeremiah, or of Joseph, or of John? Thanks to Paul's chain; how many prisons has it opened to our discourse? Will ye have that of John? He also was once bound for Christ's sake, and for the law of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:446
verses.text: What then? Was he idle when he was in prison? Was it not from thence he sent, by his disciples, and said, "Art Thou He that cometh, or look we for another?" (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:447
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:449
verses.text: ) Even when there, then, it seems he taught, for surely he did not disregard his duty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:450
verses.text: But again, did not Jeremiah prophesy concerning the king of Babylon, and fulfil his work even there in prison? And what of Joseph? Was he not in prison thirteen years? What then? Not even there did he forget his virtue.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:451
verses.text: I have yet to mention the bonds of one and therewith will close my discourse.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:452
verses.text: Our Master Himself was bound, He who loosed the world from sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:453
verses.text: Those hands were bound, those hands that wrought ten thousand good deeds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:454
verses.text: For, "they bound Him," it saith, "and led Him away to Caiaphas;" (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:455
verses.text: xxvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:456
verses.text: ; John xviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:457
verses.text: ) yes, He was bound who had wrought so many marvellous works.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:458
verses.text: Reflecting on these things, let us never repine; but whether we be in bonds, let us rejoice; or whether we be not in bonds, let us be as though we were bound together with Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 9:459
verses.text: See how great a blessing are bonds! Knowing all these things, let us send up our thanksgiving for all things to God, through Christ Jesus our Lord with whom to the Father, together with the Holy Ghost, be glory, might, and honor, now and forever and ever, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:1
verses.text: Homily IX.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:2
verses.text: Chapter IV.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:3
verses.text: Verses –  "I therefore, the prisoner in the Lord, beseech you, to walk worthily of the calling wherewith ye were called, with all lowliness and meekness, with long-suffering, forbearing one another in love; giving diligence to keep the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:4
verses.text: Great has the power of Paul's chain been shown to be, and more glorious than miracles.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:5
verses.text: It is not in vain then, as it should seem, nor without an object, that he here holds it forward, but as the means of all others most likely to touch them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:6
verses.text: And what saith he? "I therefore, the prisoner in the Lord, beseech you, to walk worthily of the calling wherewith ye were called".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:7
verses.text: And how is that? "with all lowliness and meekness, with long-suffering, forbearing one another in love".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:8
verses.text: It is not the being merely a prisoner that is honorable, but the being so for Christ's sake.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:9
verses.text: Hence he saith, "in the Lord," i-e:, the prisoner for Christ's sake.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:10
verses.text: Nothing is equal to this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:11
verses.text: But now the chain is dragging me away still more from my subject, and pulling me back again, and I cannot bear to resist it, but am drawn along willingly,—yea, rather, with all my heart; and would that it were always my lot to be descanting on Paul's chain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:12
verses.text: But now do not become drowsy: for I am yet desirous to solve that other question, which many raise, when they say, Why, if tribulation be a glory, how came Paul himself to say in his defence to Agrippa, "I would to God that whether with little or with much not thou only, but also all that hear me this day, might become such as I am, except these bonds?" (Acts xxvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:13
verses.text: ) He said not this, God forbid! as deeming the thing a matter to be deprecated; no; for had it been such, he would not have gloried in bonds, in imprisonments, in those other tribulations; and when writing elsewhere he saith, "Most gladly will I rather glory in my weaknesses".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:14
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:15
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:16
verses.text: ) But what is the case? This was itself a proof how great a thing he considered those bonds; for as in writing to the Corinthians he said, "I fed you with milk, not with meat, for ye were not yet able to bear it;" ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:17
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:18
verses.text: ) so also here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:19
verses.text: They before whom he spoke were not able to hear of the beauty, nor the comeliness, nor the blessing of those bonds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:20
verses.text: Hence it was he added, "except these bonds".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:21
verses.text: To the Hebrews however he spoke not thus, but exhorted them to "be bound with" (Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:22
verses.text: xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:23
verses.text: ) them that were in bonds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:24
verses.text: And hence too did he himself rejoice in his bonds, and was bound, and was led with the prisoners into the inner prison.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:25
verses.text: Mighty is the power of Paul's chain! A spectacle this, which may suffice for every other, to behold Paul bound, and led forth from his prison; to behold him bound, and sitting within it, what pleasure can come up to this? What would I not give for such a sight? Do ye see the emperors, the consuls, borne along in their chariots and arrayed in gold, and their body-guard with every thing about them of gold? Their halberds of gold, their shields of gold, their raiment of gold, their horses with trappings of gold? How much more delightful than such a spectacle is his! I would rather see Paul once, going forth with the prisoners from his prison, than behold these ten thousand times over, parading along with all that retinue.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:26
verses.text: When he was thus led forth, how many Angels, suppose ye, led the way before him? And to show that I speak no fiction, I will make the fact manifest to you from a certain ancient narrative.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:27
verses.text: Elisha the prophet, (perhaps ye know the man,) at the time ( Kings vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:29
verses.text: ) when the king of Syria was at war with the king of Israel, sitting at his own home, brought to light all the counsels which the king of Syria was taking in his chamber with them that were privy to his designs, and rendered the king's counsels of none effect, by telling beforehand his secrets, and not suffering the king of Israel to fall into the snares which he was laying.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:30
verses.text: This sorely troubled the king; he was disheartened, and was reduced to greater perplexity, not knowing how to discover him who was disclosing all that passed, and plotting against him, and disappointing his schemes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:31
verses.text: Whilst therefore he was in this perplexity, and enquiring into the cause, one of his armor-bearers told him, that there was a certain prophet, one Elisha, dwelling in Samaria, who suffered not the king's designs to stand, but disclosed all that passed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:32
verses.text: The king imagined that he had discovered the whole matter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:33
verses.text: Sure, never was any one more miserably misled than he.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:34
verses.text: When he ought to have honored the man, to have reverenced him, to have been awed that he really possessed so great power, as that, seated, as he was, so many furlongs off, he should know all that passed in the king's chamber, without any one at all to tell him; this indeed he did not, but being exasperated, and wholly carried away by his passion, he equips horsemen, and soldiers, and dispatches them to bring the prophet before him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:35
verses.text: Now Elisha had a disciple as yet only on the threshold of prophecy, ( Kings vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:36
verses.text: ff.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:37
verses.text: ) as yet far from being judged worthy of revelations of this kind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:38
verses.text: The king's soldiers arrived at the spot, as intending to bind the man, or rather the prophet.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:39
verses.text: —Again I am falling upon bonds, so entirely is this discourse interwoven with them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:40
verses.text: —And when the disciple saw the host of soldiers, he was affrighted, and ran full of trembling to his master, and told him the calamity, as he thought, and informed him of the inevitable peril.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:41
verses.text: The prophet smiled at him for fearing things not worthy to be feared, and bade him be of good cheer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:42
verses.text: The disciple, however, being as yet imperfect, did not listen to him, but being still amazed at the sight, remained in fear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:43
verses.text: Upon this, what did the prophet do? "Lord," said he, "open the eyes of this young man, and let him see that they which are with us, are more than they which are with them;" ( Kings vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:45
verses.text: ) and immediately he beheld the whole mountain, where the prophet then dwelt, filled with so great a multitude of horses and chariots of fire.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:46
verses.text: Now these were nothing else than ranks of Angels.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:47
verses.text: But if only for an occasion like this so great a band of Angels attended Elisha what must Paul have had? This is what the prophet David tells us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:48
verses.text: "The Angel of the Lord encampeth round about them that fear Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:49
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:50
verses.text: xxxiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:51
verses.text: ) And again; "They shall bear thee up in their hands, lest thou dash thy foot against a stone".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:52
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:53
verses.text: xci.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:54
verses.text: ) And why do I speak of Angels? The Lord Himself was with him then as he went forth; for surely it cannot be that He was seen by Abraham, and yet was not with Paul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:55
verses.text: No, it was His own promise, "I am with you alway, even unto the end of the world".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:56
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:57
verses.text: xxviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:58
verses.text: ) And again, when He appeared to him, He said, "Be not afraid, but speak, for I am with thee, and no man shall set on thee to harm thee".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:59
verses.text: (Acts xviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:61
verses.text: ) Again, He stood by him in a dream, and said, "Be of good cheer, for as thou hast testified concerning me at Jerusalem, so must thou bear witness also at Rome".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:62
verses.text: (Acts xxiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:63
verses.text: )  The saints, though they are at all times a glorious sight, and are full of abundant grace, yet are so, most of all, when they are in perils for Christ's sake, when they are prisoners; for as a brave soldier is at all times and of himself a pleasing spectacle to them that behold him, but most of all when he is standing, and in ranks at the king's side; thus also imagine to yourselves Paul, how great a thing it was to see him teaching in his bonds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:64
verses.text: Shall I mention, in passing, a thought, which just at this moment occurs to me? The blessed martyr Babylas was bound, and he too for the very same cause as John also was, because he reproved a king in his transgression.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:65
verses.text: This man when he was dying gave charge that his bonds should be laid with his body, and that the body should be buried bound; and to this day the fetters lie mingled with his ashes, so devoted was his affection for the bonds he had worn for Christ's sake.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:66
verses.text: "He was laid in chains of iron" as the Prophet saith of Joseph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:67
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:68
verses.text: cv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:69
verses.text: ) And even women have before now had trial of these bonds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:70
verses.text: We however are not in bonds, nor am I recommending this, since now is not the time for them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:71
verses.text: But thou, bind not thine hands, but bind thy heart and mind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:72
verses.text: There are yet other bonds, and they that wear not the one, shall have to wear the other.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:73
verses.text: Hear what Christ saith, "Bind him hand and foot".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:74
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:75
verses.text: xxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:76
verses.text: ) But God forbid we should have trial of those bonds! but of these may He grant us even to take our fill!  On these accounts he saith, "I, the prisoner in the Lord, beseech you to walk worthily of the calling wherewith ye were called".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:77
verses.text: But what is this calling? Ye were called as His body, it is said.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:78
verses.text: Ye have Christ as your head; and though you were "enemies," and had committed misdeeds out of number, yet "hath He raised you up with Him and made you to sit with Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:79
verses.text: (Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:80
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:81
verses.text: ) A high calling this, and to high privileges, not only in that we have been called from that former state, but in that we are called both to such privileges, and by such a method.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:82
verses.text: But how is it possible to "walk worthily" of it? "With all lowliness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:83
verses.text: Such an one walks worthily.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:84
verses.text: This is the basis of all virtue.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:85
verses.text: If thou be lowly, and bethink thee what thou art, and how thou wast saved, thou wilt take this recollection as a motive to all virtue.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:86
verses.text: Thou wilt neither be elated with bonds, nor with those very privileges which I mentioned, but as knowing that all is of grace, thou wilt humble thyself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:87
verses.text: The lowly-minded man is able to be at once a generous and a grateful servant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:88
verses.text: "For what hast thou," saith he, "that thou didst not receive?" ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:89
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:90
verses.text: ) And again, hear his words, "I labored more abundantly than they all; yet not I, but the grace of God which was with me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:91
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:92
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:93
verses.text: )  "With all lowliness," saith he; not that which is in words, nor that which is in actions only, but even in one's very bearing and tone of voice: not lowly towards one, and rude towards another; be lowly towards all men, be he friend or foe, be he great or small.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:94
verses.text: This is lowliness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:95
verses.text: Even in thy good deeds be lowly; for hear what Christ saith, "Blessed are the poor in spirit;" (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:96
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:97
verses.text: ) and He places this first in order.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:98
verses.text: Wherefore also the Apostle himself saith, "With all lowliness, and meekness, and long-suffering".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:99
verses.text: For it is possible for a man to be lowly, and yet quick and irritable, and thus all is to no purpose; for oftentimes he will be possessed by his anger, and ruin all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:100
verses.text: "Forbearing," he proceeds, "one another in love".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:101
verses.text: How is it possible to forbear, if a man be passionate or censorious? He hath told us therefore the manner: "in love," saith he.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:102
verses.text: If thou, he would say, art not forbearing to thy neighbor, how shall God be forbearing to thee? If thou bearest not with thy fellow-servant, how shall the Master bear with thee? Wherever there is love, all things are to be borne.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:103
verses.text: "Giving diligence," saith he, "to keep the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:104
verses.text: Bind therefore thy hands with moderation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:105
verses.text: Again that goodly name of "bond".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:106
verses.text: We had dismissed it, and it has of itself come back on us again.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:107
verses.text: A goodly bond was that, and goodly is this one also, and that other is the fruit of this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:108
verses.text: Bind thyself to thy brother.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:109
verses.text: They bear all things lightly who are bound together in love.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:110
verses.text: Bind thyself to him and him to thee; thou art lord of both, for whomsoever I may be desirous to make my friend, I can by means of kindliness accomplish it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:111
verses.text: "Giving diligence," he says; a thing not to be done easily, and not in every one's power.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:112
verses.text: "Giving diligence," he proceeds, "to keep the unity of the Spirit".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:113
verses.text: What is this "unity of Spirit?" In the human body there is a spirit which holds all together, though in different members.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:114
verses.text: So is it also here; for to this end was the Spirit given, that He might unite those who are separated by race and by different manners; for old and young, rich and poor, child and youth, woman and man, and every soul become in a manner one, and more entirely so than if there were one body.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:115
verses.text: For this spiritual relation is far higher than the other natural one, and the perfectness of the union more entire; because the conjunction of the soul is more perfect, inasmuch as it is both simple and uniform.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:116
verses.text: And how then is this unity preserved? "In the bond of peace".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:117
verses.text: It is not possible for this to exist in enmity and discord.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:118
verses.text: "For whereas there is," saith he, "among you jealousy and strife, are ye not carnal, and walk after the manner of men?" ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:119
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:120
verses.text: ) For as fire when it finds dry pieces of wood works up all together into one blazing pile, but when wet does not act at all nor unite them; so also it is here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:121
verses.text: Nothing that is of a cold nature can bring about this union, whereas any warm one for the most part can.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:122
verses.text: Hence at least it is that the glow of charity is produced; by the "bond of peace," he is desirous to bind us all together.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:123
verses.text: For just in the same way, he would say, as if thou wouldest attach thyself to another, thou canst do it in no other way except by attaching him to thyself; and if thou shouldest wish to make the tie double, he must needs in turn attach himself to thee; so also here he would have us tied one to another; not simply that we be at peace, not simply that we love one another, but that all should be only even one soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:124
verses.text: A glorious bond is this; with this bond let us bind ourselves together with one another and unto God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:125
verses.text: This is a bond that bruises not, nor cramps the hands it binds, but it leaves them free, and gives them ample play, and greater courage than those which are at liberty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:126
verses.text: The strong if he be bound to the weak, will support him, and not suffer him to perish: and if again he be tied to the indolent, him he will rather rouse and animate.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:127
verses.text: "Brother helped by brother," it is said, "is as a strong city".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:128
verses.text: This chain no distance of place can interrupt, neither heaven, nor earth, nor death, nor any thing else, but it is more powerful and strong than all things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:129
verses.text: This, though it issue from but one soul, is able to embrace numbers at once; for hear what Paul saith, "Ye are not straitened in us, but ye are straitened in your own affections; be ye also enlarged".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:130
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:131
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:132
verses.text: )  Now then, what impairs this bond? Love of money, passion for power, for glory, and the like, loosens them, and severs them asunder.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:133
verses.text: How then are we to see that they be not cut asunder? If these tempers be got rid of, and none of those things which destroy charity come in by the way to trouble us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:134
verses.text: For hear what Christ saith, (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:135
verses.text: xxiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:136
verses.text: ) "Because iniquity shall be multiplied, the love of the many shall wax cold".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:137
verses.text: Nothing is so opposed to love as sin, and I mean not love towards God, but that towards our neighbor also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:138
verses.text: But how then, it may be said, are even robbers at peace? When are they, tell me? Not when they are acting in a spirit which is that of robbers; for if they fail to observe the rules of justice amongst those with whom they divide the spoil, and to render to every one his right, you will find them too in wars and broils.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:139
verses.text: So that neither amongst the wicked is it possible to find peace: but where men are living in righteousness and virtue, you may find it every where.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:140
verses.text: But again, are rivals ever at peace? Never.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:141
verses.text: And whom then would ye have me mention? The covetous man can never possibly be at peace with the covetous.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:142
verses.text: So that were there not just and good persons, even though wronged by them, to stand between them, the whole race of them would be torn to pieces.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:143
verses.text: When two wild beasts are famished, if there be not something put between them to consume, they will devour one another.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:144
verses.text: The same would be the case with the covetous and the vicious.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:145
verses.text: So that it is not possible there should be peace where virtue is not already put in practice beforehand.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:146
verses.text: Let us form, if you please, a city entirely of covetous men, give them equal privileges, and let no one bear to be wronged, but let all wrong one another.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:147
verses.text: Can that city possibly hold together? It is impossible.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:148
verses.text: Again, is there peace amongst adulterers? No, not any two will you find of the same mind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:149
verses.text: So then, to return, there is no other reason for this, than that "love hath waxed cold;" and the cause again why love hath waxed cold, is that "iniquity abounds".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:150
verses.text: For this leads to selfishness, and divides and severs the body, and relaxes it and rends it to pieces.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:151
verses.text: But where virtue is, it does the reverse.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:152
verses.text: Because the man that is virtuous is also above money; so that were there ten thousand such in poverty they would still be peaceable; whilst the covetous, where there are but two, can never be at peace.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:153
verses.text: Thus then if we are virtuous, love will not perish, for virtue springs from love, and love from virtue.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:154
verses.text: And how this is, I will tell you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:155
verses.text: The virtuous man does not value money above friendship, nor does he remember injuries, nor does wrong to his neighbor; he is not insolent, he endures all things nobly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:156
verses.text: Of these things love consists.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:157
verses.text: Again, he who loves submits to all these things, and thus do they reciprocally produce one another.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:158
verses.text: And this indeed, that love springs from virtue, appears from hence, because our Lord when He saith, "because iniquity shall be multiplied, the love of the many shall wax cold," plainly tells us this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:159
verses.text: And that virtue springs from love, Paul tells us, saying, "He that loveth his neighbor hath fulfilled the law".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:160
verses.text: (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:161
verses.text: xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:162
verses.text: ) So then a man must be one of the two, either very affectionate and much beloved, or else very virtuous; for he who has the one, of necessity possesses the other; and, on the contrary, he who knows not how to love, will therefore commit many evil actions; and he who commits evil actions, knows not what it is to love.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:163
verses.text: Moral.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:164
verses.text: Let us therefore follow after charity; it is a safeguard which will not allow us to suffer any evil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:165
verses.text: Let us bind ourselves together.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:166
verses.text: Let there be no deceit amongst us, no hollowness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:167
verses.text: For where friendship is, there nothing of the sort is found.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:168
verses.text: This too another certain wise man tells us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:169
verses.text: "Though thou drewest a sword at thy friend, yet despair not: for there may be a returning again to favor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:170
verses.text: If thou hast opened thy mouth against thy friend, fear not; for there may be a reconciliation: except for upbraiding, or disclosing of secrets, or a treacherous wound: for for these things a friend will depart".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:171
verses.text: (Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:172
verses.text: xxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:174
verses.text: ) For "disclosing," saith he, "of secrets".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:175
verses.text: Now if we be all friends, there is no need of secrets; for as no man has any secret with himself and cannot conceal anything from himself, so neither will he from his friends.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:176
verses.text: Where then no secrets exist, separation arising from this is impossible.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:177
verses.text: For no other reason have we secrets, than because we have not confidence in all men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:178
verses.text: So then it is the waxing cold of love, which has produced secrets.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:179
verses.text: For what secret hast thou? Dost thou desire to wrong thy neighbor? Or, art thou hindering him from sharing some benefit, and on this account concealest it? But, no, perhaps it is none of these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:180
verses.text: What then, is it that thou art ashamed? If so, then this is a token of want of confidence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:181
verses.text: Now then if there be love, there will be no "revealing of secrets," neither any "upbraiding".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:182
verses.text: For who, tell me, would ever upbraid his own soul? And suppose even such a thing were done, it would be for some good; for we upbraid children, we know, when we desire to make them feel.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:183
verses.text: And so Christ too on that occasion began to upbraid the cities, saying, "Woe unto thee, Chorazin! woe unto thee, Bethsaida!" (Luke x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:184
verses.text: ) in order that He might deliver them from upbraidings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:185
verses.text: For nothing has such power to lay hold of the mind, or can more strongly arouse it, or brace it up when relaxed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:186
verses.text: Let us then never use upbraiding to one another merely for the sake of upbraiding.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:187
verses.text: For what? Wilt thou upbraid thy friend on the score of money? Surely not, if at least thou possessest what thou hast in common.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:188
verses.text: Wilt thou then for his faults? No nor this, but thou wilt rather in that case correct him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:189
verses.text: Or, as it goes on, "for a treacherous wound;" who in the world will kill himself, or who wound himself? No one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:190
verses.text: Let us then "follow after love;" he saith not simply let us love; but let us "follow after love".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:191
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:192
verses.text: xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:193
verses.text: ) There is need of much eagerness: she is soon out of sight, she is most rapid in her flight; so many things are there in life which injure her.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:194
verses.text: If we follow her, she will not outstrip us and get away, but we shall speedily recover her.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:195
verses.text: The love of God is that which united earth to Heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:196
verses.text: It was the love of God that seated man upon the kingly throne.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:197
verses.text: It was the love of God that manifested God upon earth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:198
verses.text: It was the love of God that made the Lord a servant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:199
verses.text: It was the love of God that caused the Beloved to be delivered up for His enemies, the Son for them that hated Him, the Lord for His servants, God for men, the free for slaves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:200
verses.text: Nor did it stop here, but called us to yet greater things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:201
verses.text: Yes, not only did it release us from our former evils, but promised, moreover, to bestow upon us other much greater blessings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 10:202
verses.text: For these things then let us give thanks to God, and follow after every virtue; and before all things, let us with all strictness practice love, that we may be counted worthy to attain the promised blessings; through the grace and loving-kindness of our Lord Jesus Christ, with whom, to the Father together with the Holy Ghost, be glory, might, and honor, now and for ever and ever, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:1
verses.text: Homily X.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:2
verses.text: Ephesians iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:3
verses.text: "There is one body, and one Spirit, even as ye are called in one hope of your calling".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:4
verses.text: When the blessed Paul exhorts us to anything of special importance, so truly wise and spiritual as he is, he grounds his exhortation upon things in Heaven: this itself being a lesson he had learned from the Lord.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:5
verses.text: Thus he saith also elsewhere, "Walk in love, even as Christ also hath loved us".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:6
verses.text: (ch.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:7
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:8
verses.text: ) And again, "Have this mind in you, which was also in Christ Jesus, who being in the form of God, counted it not a prize to be on an equality with God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:9
verses.text: (Philip.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:10
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:12
verses.text: ) This is what he is doing here also, for whenever the examples he is setting before us are great, he is intense in his zeal and feeling.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:13
verses.text: What then does he say, now he is inciting us to unity? "There is one body, and one Spirit, even as ye are called in one hope of your calling:"  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:14
verses.text: "One Lord, one faith, one baptism".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:15
verses.text: Now what is this one body? The faithful throughout the whole world, both which are, and which have been, and which shall be.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:16
verses.text: And again, they that before Christ's coming pleased God, are "one body".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:17
verses.text: How so? Because they also knew Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:18
verses.text: Whence does this appear? "Your father Abraham," saith He, "rejoiced to see My day, and he saw it, and was glad".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:19
verses.text: (John viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:20
verses.text: ) And again, "If ye had believed Moses," He saith, "ye would have believed Me, for he wrote of Me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:21
verses.text: (John v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:22
verses.text: ) And the prophets too would not have written of One, of whom they knew not what they said; whereas they both knew Him, and worshiped Him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:23
verses.text: Thus then were they also "one body".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:24
verses.text: The body is not disjoined from the spirit, for then would it not be a body.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:25
verses.text: Thus it is customary also with us, touching things which are united, and which have any great consistency or coherence, to say, they are one body.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:26
verses.text: And thus again, touching union, we take that to be a body which is under one head.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:27
verses.text: If there be one head, then is there one body.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:28
verses.text: The body is composed of members both honorable and dishonorable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:29
verses.text: Only the greater is not to rise up even against the meanest, nor this latter to envy the other.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:30
verses.text: They do not all indeed contribute the same share, but severally according to the proportion of need.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:31
verses.text: And forasmuch as all are formed for necessary and for different purposes, all are of equal honor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:32
verses.text: Some indeed there are, which are more especially principal members, others less so: for example, the head is more a principal member than all the rest of the body, as containing within itself all the senses, and the governing principle of the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:33
verses.text: And to live without the head is impossible; whereas many persons have lived for a long time with their feet cut off.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:34
verses.text: So that it is better than they, not only by its position, but also by its very vital energy and its function.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:35
verses.text: Now why am I saying this? There are great numbers in the Church; there are those who, like the head, are raised up to a height; who, like the eyes that are in the head, survey heavenly things, who stand far aloof from the earth, and have nothing in common with it, whilst others occupy the rank of feet, and tread upon the earth; of healthy feet indeed, for to tread upon the earth is no crime in feet, but to run to evil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:36
verses.text: "Their feet," saith the Prophet, "run to evil".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:37
verses.text: (Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:38
verses.text: lix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:39
verses.text: ) Neither then let these, the head, saith he, be high-minded against the feet, nor the feet look with evil eye at them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:40
verses.text: For thus the peculiar beauty of each is destroyed, and the perfectness of its function impeded.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:41
verses.text: And naturally enough; inasmuch as he who lays snares for his neighbor will be laying snares first of all for himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:42
verses.text: And should the feet therefore not choose to convey the head anywhere upon its necessary journey, they will at the same time be injuring themselves by their inactivity and sloth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:43
verses.text: Or again, should the head not choose to take any care of the feet, itself will be the first to sustain the damage.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:44
verses.text: However, those members do not rise up one against the other; it is not likely, for it has been so ordered by nature that they should not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:45
verses.text: But with man, how is it possible for him not to rise up against man? No one, we know, ever rises up against Angels; since neither do they rise against the Archangels.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:46
verses.text: Nor, on the other hand, can the irrational creatures proudly exalt themselves over us; but where the nature is equal in dignity, and the gift one, and where one has no more than another, how shall this be prevented?  And yet surely these are the very reasons why thou oughtest not to rise up against thy neighbors.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:47
verses.text: For if all things are common, and one has nothing more than another, whence this mad folly? We partake of the same nature, partake alike of soul and body, we breathe the same air, we use the same food.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:48
verses.text: Whence this rebellious rising of one against another? And yet truly the being able by one's virtue to overcome the incorporeal powers, that were enough to lead to arrogance; or rather arrogance it would not be, for with good reason am I high-minded, and exceedingly high-minded against the evil spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:49
verses.text: And behold even Paul, how high-minded he was against that evil spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:50
verses.text: For when the evil spirit was speaking great and marvelous things concerning him, he made him hold his peace, and endured him not even in his flattery.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:51
verses.text: For when that damsel, "who had the spirit of divination," cried, saying, "These men are the servants of the most high God, which show unto us the way of salvation" (Acts xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:53
verses.text: ), he rebuked him severely, and silenced his forward tongue.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:54
verses.text: And again he elsewhere writes, and says, "God shall bruise Satan under your feet shortly".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:55
verses.text: (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:56
verses.text: xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:57
verses.text: ) Will the difference of nature have any effect? Perceivest thou not that the difference between natures has no effect whatever, but only the difference of purpose? Because of their principle therefore they are far worse than all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:58
verses.text: Well, a man may say, but I am not rising up against an Angel, because there is so vast a distance between my nature and his.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:59
verses.text: And yet surely thou oughtest no more to rise up against a man than against an Angel, for the Angel indeed differs from thee in nature, a matter which can be neither an honor to him, nor a disgrace to thee: whereas man differs from man not at all in nature, but in principle; and there is such a thing as an Angel too even amongst men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:60
verses.text: So that if thou rise not up against Angels, much more shouldest thou not against men, against those who have become angels in this our nature; for should any one among men become as virtuous as an Angel, that man is in a far higher degree superior to thee, than an Angel is.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:61
verses.text: And why so? Because what the one possesses by nature, the other has achieved of his own purpose.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:62
verses.text: And again, because the Angel has his home far from thee in distance also, and dwelleth in Heaven; whereas this man is living with thee, and giving an impulse to thy emulation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:63
verses.text: And indeed he lives farther apart from thee than the Angel.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:64
verses.text: For "our citizenship," saith the Apostle, "is in Heaven".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:65
verses.text: (Philip.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:66
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:67
verses.text: ) And to show thee that this man hath his home still farther distant, hear where his Head is seated; upon the throne, saith he, the royal throne! And the farther distant that throne is from us, the farther is he also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:68
verses.text: Well, but I see him, thou wilt say, in the enjoyment of honor, and I am led to jealousy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:69
verses.text: Why, this is the very thing which has turned all things upside down, which has filled not the world only, but the Church also, with countless troubles.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:70
verses.text: And just as fierce blasts setting in across a calm harbor, render it more dangerous than any rock, or than any strait whatever; so the lust of glory entering in, overturns and confounds everything.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:71
verses.text: Ye have oftentimes been present at the burning of large houses.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:72
verses.text: Ye have seen how the smoke keeps rising up to Heaven; and if no one comes near to put a stop to the mischief, but every one keeps looking to himself, the flame spreads freely on, and devours everything.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:73
verses.text: And oftentimes the whole city will stand around; they will stand round indeed as spectators of the evil, not to aid nor assist.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:74
verses.text: And there you may see them one and all standing round, and doing nothing but each individual stretching out his hand, and pointing out to some one who may be just come to the spot, either a flaming brand that moment flying through a window, or beams hurled down, or the whole circuit of the walls forced out, and tumbling violently to the ground.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:75
verses.text: Many too there are of the more daring and venturesome, who will have the hardihood even to come close to the very buildings themselves whilst they are burning, not in order to stretch forth a hand towards them, and to put a stop to the mischief, but that they may the more fully enjoy the sight, being able from the nearer place to observe closely all that which often escapes those at a distance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:76
verses.text: Then if the house happen to be large and magnificent, it appears to them a pitiable spectacle, and deserving of many tears.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:77
verses.text: And truly there is a pitiable spectacle for us to behold; capitals of columns crumbled to dust, and many columns themselves shattered to pieces, some consumed by the fire, others thrown down often by the very hands which erected them, that they may not add fuel to the flame.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:78
verses.text: Statues again, which stood with so much gracefulness, with the ceiling resting on them, these you may see all exposed, with the roof torn off, and themselves standing hideously disfigured in the open air.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:79
verses.text: And why should one go on to describe the wealth stored up within? the tissues of gold, and the vessels of silver? And where the lord of the house and his consort scarcely entered, where was the treasurehouse of tissues and perfumes, and the caskets of the costly jewels,—all has become one blazing fire, and within now, are bath-men and street-cleaners, and runaway slaves, and everybody; and everything within is one mass of fire and water, of mud, and dust, and half-burnt beams!  Now why have I drawn out so full a picture as this? Not simply because I wish to represent to you the conflagration of a house, (for what concern is that of mine?) but because I wish to set before your eyes, as vividly as I can, the calamities of the Church.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:80
verses.text: For like a conflagration indeed, or like a thunderbolt hurled from on high, have they lighted upon the roof of the Church, and yet they rouse up no one; but whilst our Father's house is burning, we are sleeping, as it were, a deep and stupid sleep.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:81
verses.text: And yet who is there whom this fire does not touch? Which of the statues that stand in the Church? for the Church is nothing else than a house built of the souls of us men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:82
verses.text: Now this house is not of equal honor throughout, but of the stones which contribute to it, some are bright and shining, whilst others are smaller and more dull than they, and yet superior again to others.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:83
verses.text: There we may see many who are in the place of gold also, the gold which adorns the ceiling.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:84
verses.text: Others again we may see, who give the beauty and gracefulness produced by statues.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:85
verses.text: Many we may see, standing like pillars.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:86
verses.text: For he is accustomed to call men also "pillars" (Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:87
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:88
verses.text: ), not only on account of their strength but also on account of their beauty, adding as they do, much grace, and having their heads overlaid with gold.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:89
verses.text: We may see a multitude, forming generally the wide middle space and the whole extent of the circumference; for the body at large occupies the place of those stones of which the outer walls are built.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:90
verses.text: Or rather we must go on to a more splendid picture yet.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:91
verses.text: This Church, of which I speak, is not built of these stones, such as we see around us, but of gold and silver, and of precious stones, and there is abundance of gold dispersed everywhere throughout it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:92
verses.text: But, oh the bitter tears this calls forth! For all these things hath the lawless rule of vainglory consumed; that all-devouring flame, which no one has yet got under.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:93
verses.text: And we stand gazing in amazement at the flames, but no longer able to quench the evil: or if we do quench it for a short time, yet after two or three days as a spark blown up from a heap of ashes overturns all, and consumes no less than it did before, so it is here also: for this is just what is wont to happen in such a conflagration.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:94
verses.text: And as to the cause, it has devoured the supports of the very pillars of the Church; those of us who supported the roof, and who formerly held the whole building together it has enveloped in the flame.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:95
verses.text: Hence too was a ready communication to the rest of the outer walls: for so also in the case of buildings, when the fire lays hold of the timbers, it is better armed for its attack upon the stones; but when it has brought down the pillars and leveled them with the ground, nothing more is wanted to consume all the rest in the flames.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:96
verses.text: For when the props and supports of the upper parts fall down, those parts also themselves will speedily enough follow them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:97
verses.text: Thus is it also at this moment with the Church: the fire has laid hold on every part.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:98
verses.text: We seek the honors that come from man, we burn for glory, and we hearken not to Job when he saith,  "If like Adam (or after the manner of men) I covered my transgressions  By hiding mine iniquity in my bosom,  Because I feared the great multitude".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:99
verses.text: Behold ye a virtuous spirit? I was not ashamed, he saith, to own before the whole multitude my involuntary sins: And if he was not ashamed to confess, much more were it our duty to do so.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:100
verses.text: For saith the prophet, "Set thou forth thy cause, that thou mayest be justified".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:101
verses.text: (Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:102
verses.text: xliii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:103
verses.text: ) Great is the violence of this evil, everything is overturned by it and annihilated.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:104
verses.text: We have forsaken the Lord, and are become slaves of honor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:105
verses.text: We are no longer able to rebuke those who are under our rule, because we ourselves also are possessed with the same fever as they.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:106
verses.text: We who are appointed by God to heal others, need the physician ourselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:107
verses.text: What further hope of recovery is there left, when even the very physicians themselves need the healing hand of others?  I have not said these things without an object, nor am I making lamentations to no purpose, but with the view that one and all, with our women and children, having sprinkled ourselves with ashes, and girded ourselves about with sackcloth, may keep a long fast, may beseech God Himself to stretch forth His hand to us, and to stay the peril.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:108
verses.text: For need is there indeed of His hand, that mighty, that marvelous hand.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:109
verses.text: Greater things are required of us than of the Ninevites.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:110
verses.text: "Yet three days," said the prophet, "and Nineveh shall be overthrown".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:111
verses.text: (Jonah iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:112
verses.text: ) A fearful message, and burdened with tremendous threat.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:113
verses.text: And how should it be otherwise? to expect that within three days, the city should become their tomb, and that all should perish in one common judgment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:114
verses.text: For if, when it happens that two children die at the same time in one house, the hardship becomes intolerable, and if to Job this of all things seemed the most intolerable, that the roof fell in upon all his children, and they were thus killed; what must it be to behold not one house, nor two children, but a nation of a hundred and twenty thousand buried beneath the ruins!  Ye know how terrible a disaster is this, for lately has this very warning happened to us, not that any prophet uttered a voice, for we are not worthy to hear such a voice, but the warning crying aloud from on high more distinctly than any trumpet.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:115
verses.text: However, as I was saying, "Yet three days," said the prophet, "and Nineveh shall be overthrown".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:116
verses.text: A terrible warning indeed, but now we have nothing even like that; no, there are no longer "three days," nor is there a Nineveh to be overthrown, but many days are already past since the Church throughout all the world has been overthrown, and leveled with the ground, and all alike are overwhelmed in the evil; nay more, of those that are in high places the stress is so much the greater.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:117
verses.text: Wonder not therefore if I should exhort you to do greater things than the Ninevites; and why? nay more, I do not now proclaim a fast only, but I suggest to you the remedy which raised up that city also when falling.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:118
verses.text: And what was that? "God saw their works," saith the prophet, "that they turned from their evil way, and God repented of the evil which He said He would do unto them".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:119
verses.text: (Jonah iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:120
verses.text: ) This let us do, both we and you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:121
verses.text: Let us renounce the passion for riches, the lust for glory, beseeching God to stretch forth His hand, and to raise up our fallen members.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:122
verses.text: And well may we, for our fear is not for the same objects as theirs; for then indeed it was only stones and timbers that were to fall, and bodies that were to perish; but now it is none of these; no, but souls are about to be delivered over to hell fire.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 11:123
verses.text: Let us implore, let us confess unto Him, let us give thanks unto Him for what is past, let us entreat Him for what is to come, that we may be counted worthy to be delivered from this fierce and most terrible monster, and to lift up our thanksgivings to the loving God and Father with whom, to the Son, together with the Holy Ghost, be glory, might, and honor, now, henceforth, and for ever and ever, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:1
verses.text: Homily XI.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:2
verses.text: Ephesians iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:3
verses.text: –  "There is one body, and one Spirit, even as also ye were called in one hope of your calling; one Lord, one faith, one baptism, one God and Father of all, who is over all, and through all, and in all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:4
verses.text: But unto each one of us was the grace given according to the measure of the gift of Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:5
verses.text: The love Paul requires of us is no common love, but that which cements us together, and makes us cleave inseparably to one another, and effects as great and as perfect a union as though it were between limb and limb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:6
verses.text: For this is that love which produces great and glorious fruits.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:7
verses.text: Hence he saith, there is "one body"; one, both by sympathy, and by not opposing the good of others, and by sharing their joy, having expressed all at once by this figure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:8
verses.text: He then beautifully adds, "and one Spirit," showing that from the one body there will be one Spirit: or, that it is possible that there may be indeed one body, and yet not one Spirit; as, for instance, if any member of it should be a friend of heretics: or else he is, by this expression, shaming them into unanimity, saying, as it were, "Ye who have received one Spirit, and have been made to drink at one fountain, ought not to be divided in mind"; or else by spirit here he means their zeal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:9
verses.text: Then he adds, "Even as ye were called in one hope of your calling," that is, God hath called you all on the same terms.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:10
verses.text: He hath bestowed nothing upon one more than upon another.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:11
verses.text: To all He hath freely given immortality, to all eternal life, to all immortal glory, to all brotherhood, to all inheritance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:12
verses.text: He is the common Head of all; "He hath raised all" up, "and made them sit with Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:13
verses.text: (Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:14
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:15
verses.text: ) Ye then who in the spiritual world have so great equality of privileges, whence is it that ye are high-minded? Is it that one is wealthy and another strong? How ridiculous must this be? For tell me, if the emperor some day were to take ten persons, and to array them all in purple, and seat them on the royal throne, and to bestow upon all the same honor, would any one of these, think ye, venture to reproach another, as being more wealthy or more illustrious than he? Surely never.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:16
verses.text: And I have not yet said all; for the difference is not so great in heaven as here below we differ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:17
verses.text: There is "one Lord, one faith, one baptism".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:18
verses.text: Behold "the hope of your calling.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:19
verses.text: One God and Father of all, who is over all, and through all, and in all".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:20
verses.text: For can it be, that thou art called by the name of a greater God, another, of a lesser God? That thou art saved by faith, and another by works? That thou hast received remission in baptism, whilst another has not? "There is one God and Father of all, who is over all, and through all, and in all".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:21
verses.text: "Who is over all," that is, the Lord and above all; and "through all," that is, providing for, ordering all; and "in you all," that is, who dwelleth in you all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:22
verses.text: Now this they own to be an attribute of the Son; so that were it an argument of inferiority, it never would have been said of the Father.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:23
verses.text: "But unto each one of us was the grace given".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:24
verses.text: What then? he saith, whence are those diverse spiritual gifts? For this subject was continually carrying away both the Ephesians themselves, and the Corinthians, and many others, some into vain arrogance, and others into despondency or envy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:25
verses.text: Hence he everywhere takes along with him this illustration of the body.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:26
verses.text: Hence it is that now also he has proposed it, inasmuch as he was about to make mention of diverse gifts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:27
verses.text: He enters indeed into the subject more fully in the Epistle to the Corinthians, because it was among them that this malady most especially reigned: here however he has only alluded to it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:28
verses.text: And mark what he says: he does not say, "according to the faith of each," lest he should throw those who have no large attainments into despondency.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:29
verses.text: But what saith he? "According to the measure of the gift of Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:30
verses.text: The chief and principal points of all, he saith,—Baptism, the being saved by faith, the having God for our Father, our all partaking of the same Spirit,—these are common to all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:31
verses.text: If then this or that man possesses any superiority in any spiritual gift, grieve not at it; since his labor also is greater.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:32
verses.text: He that had received the five talents, had five required of him; whilst he that had received the two, brought only two, and yet received no less a reward than the other.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:33
verses.text: And therefore the Apostle here also encourages the hearer on the same ground, showing that gifts are bestowed not for the honor of one above another, but for the work of the church, even as he says further on:  "For the perfecting of the saints unto the work of ministering unto the building up of the body of Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:34
verses.text: Hence it is that even he himself saith, "Woe is unto me, if I preach not the Gospel".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:35
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:36
verses.text: ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:37
verses.text: ) For example: he received the grace of Apostleship, but for this very reason, "woe unto him," because he received it: whereas thou art free from the danger.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:38
verses.text: "According to the measure".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:39
verses.text: What is meant by, "according to the measure"? It means, "not according to our merit," for then would no one have received what he has received: but of the free gift we have all received.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:40
verses.text: And why then one more, and another less? There is nothing to cause this, he would say, but the matter itself is indifferent; for every one contributes towards "the building".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:41
verses.text: And by this too he shows, that it is not of his own intrinsic merit that one has received more and another less, but that it is for the sake of others, as God Himself hath measured it; since he saith also elsewhere, "But now hath God set the members each one of them in the body, even as it pleased Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:42
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:43
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:44
verses.text: ) And he mentions not the reason, lest he should deject or dispirit the hearers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:45
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:46
verses.text: "Wherefore he saith, When He ascended on high, He led captivity captive, and gave gifts unto men".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:47
verses.text: As though he had said, Why art thou high-minded? The whole is of God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:48
verses.text: The Prophet saith in the Psalm, "Thou hast received gifts among men" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:49
verses.text: lxviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:50
verses.text: ), whereas the Apostle saith, "He gave gifts unto men".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:51
verses.text: The one is the same as the other.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:52
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:54
verses.text: "Now this, He ascended, what is it, but that He also descended into the lower parts of the earth? He that descended, is the same also that ascended far above all the Heavens, that He might fill all things".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 12:55
