verses.text: "And forbear threatening;" be not irritating, he means, nor oppressive.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:61
verses.text: "Knowing that both their Master and yours is in Heaven".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:62
verses.text: Ah! How mighty a Master does he hint at here! How startling the suggestion! It is this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:63
verses.text: "With what measure thou metest, it shall be measured unto thee again" (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:64
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:65
verses.text: ); lest thou hear the sentence, "Thou wicked servant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:66
verses.text: I forgave thee all that debt".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:67
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:68
verses.text: xviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:69
verses.text: )  "And there is no respect of persons," he saith, "with Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:70
verses.text: Think not, he would say, that what is done towards a servant, He will therefore forgive, because done to a servant.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:71
verses.text: Heathen laws indeed as being the laws of men, recognize a difference between these kinds of offenses.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:72
verses.text: But the law of the common Lord and Master of all, as doing good to all alike, and dispensing the same rights to all, knows no such difference.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:73
verses.text: But should any one ask, whence is slavery, and why it has found entrance into human life, (and many I know are both glad to ask such questions, and desirous to be informed of them,) I will tell you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:74
verses.text: Slavery is the fruit of covetousness, of degradation, of savagery; since Noah, we know, had no servant, nor had Abel, nor Seth, no, nor they who came after them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:75
verses.text: The thing was the fruit of sin, of rebellion against parents.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:76
verses.text: Let children hearken to this, that whenever they are undutiful to their parents, they deserve to be servants.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:77
verses.text: Such a child strips himself of his nobility of birth; for he who rebels against his father is no longer a son; and if he who rebels against his father is not a son, how shall he be a son who rebels against our true Father? He has departed from his nobility of birth, he has done outrage to nature.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:78
verses.text: Then come also wars, and battles, and take their prisoners.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:79
verses.text: Well, but Abraham, you will say, had servants.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:80
verses.text: Yes, but he used them not as servants.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:81
verses.text: Observe how everything depends upon the head; the wife, by telling him "to love her"; the children, by telling him "to bring them up in the chastening and admonition of the Lord"; the servants, by the words, "knowing that both their Master and yours is in Heaven".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:82
verses.text: So, saith he, ye also in like manner, as being yourselves servants, shall be kind and indulgent.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:83
verses.text: "Finally, be strong in the Lord and in the strength of His might".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:84
verses.text: But if, before considering this next, ye have a mind to hearken, I shall make the same remarks concerning servants, as I have also made before concerning children.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:85
verses.text: Teach them to be religious, and everything else will follow of necessity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:86
verses.text: But now, when any one is going to the theater, or going off to the bath, he drags all his servants after him; but when he goes to church, not for a moment; nor does he compel them to attend and hear.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:87
verses.text: Now how shall thy servant listen, when thou his master art attending to other things? Hast thou purchased, hast thou bought thy slave? Before all things enjoin him what God would have him do, to be gentle towards his fellow-servants, and to make much account of virtue.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:88
verses.text: Every one's house is a city; and every man is a prince in his own house.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:89
verses.text: That the house of the rich is of this character, is plain enough, where there are both lands, and stewards, and rulers over rulers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:90
verses.text: But I say that the house of the poor also is a city.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:91
verses.text: Because here too there are offices of authority; for instance, the husband has authority over the wife, the wife over the servants, the servants again over their own wives; again the wives and the husbands over the children.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:92
verses.text: Does he not seem to you to be, as it were, a sort of king, having so many authorities under his own authority? and that it were meet that he should be more skilled both in domestic and general government than all the rest? For he who knows how to manage these in their several relations, will know how to select the fittest men for offices, yes, and will choose excellent ones.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:93
verses.text: And thus the wife will be a second king in the house, lacking only the diadem; and he who knows how to choose this king, will excellently regulate all the rest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:94
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:95
verses.text: "Finally," saith he, "be strong in the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:96
verses.text: Whenever the discourse is about to conclude, he always employs this turn.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:97
verses.text: Said I not well from the first, that every man's house is a camp in itself? For look, having disposed of the several offices, he proceeds to arm them, and to lead them out to war.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:98
verses.text: If no one usurps the other's office, but every one remains at his post, all will be well ordered.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:99
verses.text: "Be strong," saith he, "in the Lord, and in the strength of His might".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:100
verses.text: That is, in the hope which we have in Him, by means of His aid.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:101
verses.text: For as he had enjoined many duties, which were necessary to be done, fear not, he seems to say, cast your hope upon the Lord, and He will make all easy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:102
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:103
verses.text: "Put on the whole armor of God, that ye may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:104
verses.text: He saith not, against the fightings, nor against the hostilities, but against the "wiles".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:105
verses.text: For this enemy is at war with us, not simply, nor openly, but by "wiles".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:106
verses.text: What is meant by wiles? To use "wiles," is to deceive and to take by artifice or contrivance; a thing which takes place both in the case of the arts, and by words, and actions, and stratagems, in the case of those who seduce us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:107
verses.text: I mean something like this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:108
verses.text: The Devil never proposes to us sins in their proper colors; he does not speak of idolatry, but he sets it off in another dress, using "wiles," that is, making his discourse plausible, employing disguises.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:109
verses.text: Now therefore the Apostle is by this means both rousing the soldiers, and making them vigilant, by persuading and instructing them, that our conflict is with one skilled in the arts of war, and with one who wars not simply, nor directly, but with much wiliness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:110
verses.text: And first then he arouses the disciples from the consideration of the Devil's skill; but in the second place, from his nature, and the number of his forces.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:111
verses.text: It is not from any desire to dispirit the soldiers that stand under him, but to arouse, and to awaken them, that he mentions these stratagems, and prepares them to be vigilant; for had he merely detailed their power, and there stopped his discourse, he must have dispirited them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:112
verses.text: But now, whereas both before and after this, he shows that it is possible to overcome such an enemy, he rather raises their courage; for the more clearly the strength of our adversaries is stated on our part to our own people, so much the more earnest will it render our soldiers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:113
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:114
verses.text: "For our wrestling is not," saith he, "against flesh and blood, but against the principalities, against the powers, against the world-rulers of this darkness, against the spiritual hosts of wickedness, in the heavenly places".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:115
verses.text: Having stimulated them by the character of the conflict, he next goes on to arouse them also by the prizes set before them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:116
verses.text: For what is his argument? Having said that the enemies are fierce, he adds further, that they despoil us of vast blessings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:117
verses.text: What are these? The conflict lies "in the heavenlies"; the struggle is not about riches, not about glory, but about our being enslaved.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:118
verses.text: And thus is the enmity irreconcilable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:119
verses.text: The strife and the conflict are fiercer when for vast interests at stake; for the expression "in the heavenlies" is equivalent to, "for the heavenly things".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:120
verses.text: It is not that they may gain anything by the conquest, but that they may despoil us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:121
verses.text: As if one were to say, "In what does the contract lie?" In gold.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:122
verses.text: The word "in," means, "in behalf of"; the word "in," also means, "on account of".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:123
verses.text: Observe how the power of the enemy startles us; how it makes us all circumspection, to know that the hazard is on behalf of vast interests, and the victory for the sake of great rewards.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:124
verses.text: For he is doing his best to cast us out of Heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:125
verses.text: He speaks of certain "principalities, and powers, and world-rulers of this darkness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:126
verses.text: What darkness? Is it that of night? No, but of wickedness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:127
verses.text: "For ye were," saith he, "once darkness" (Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:128
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:129
verses.text: ); so naming that wickedness which is in this present life; for beyond it, it will have no place, not in Heaven, nor in the world to come.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:130
verses.text: "World-rulers" he calls them, not as having the mastery over the world, but the Scripture is wont to call wicked practices "the world," as, for example, where Christ saith, "They are not of this world, even as I am not of the world".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:131
verses.text: (John xvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:132
verses.text: ) What then, were they not of the world? Were they not clothed with flesh? Were they not of those who are in the world? And again; "The world hateth Me, but you it cannot hate".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:133
verses.text: (John vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:134
verses.text: ) Where again He calls wicked practices by this name.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:135
verses.text: Thus the Apostle here by the world means wicked men, and the evil spirits have more especial power over them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:136
verses.text: "Against the spiritual hosts of wickedness," saith he, "in the heavenly places".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:137
verses.text: "Principalities, and powers," he speaks of; just as in the heavenly places there are "thrones and dominions, principalities and powers".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:138
verses.text: (Col.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:139
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:140
verses.text: )  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:141
verses.text: "Wherefore," saith he, "take up the whole armor of God, that ye may be able to withstand in the evil day, and, having done all, to stand".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:142
verses.text: By "evil day" he means the present life, and calls it too "this present evil world" (Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:143
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:144
verses.text: ), from the evils which are done in it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:145
verses.text: It is as much as to say, Always be armed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:146
verses.text: And again, "having done all," saith he; that is, both passions, and vile lusts, and all things else that trouble us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:147
verses.text: He speaks not merely of doing the deed, but of completing it, so as not only to slay, but to stand also after we have slain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:148
verses.text: For many who have gained this victory, have fallen again.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:149
verses.text: "Having done," saith he, "all"; not having done one, but not the other.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:150
verses.text: For even after the victory, we must stand.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:151
verses.text: An enemy may be struck, but things that are struck revive again if we do not stand.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:152
verses.text: But if after having fallen they rise up again, so long as we stand, they are fallen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:153
verses.text: So long as we waver not, the adversary rises not again.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:154
verses.text: "Let us put on the whole armor of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:155
verses.text: Seest thou how he banishes all fear? For if it be possible "to do all, and to stand," his describing in detail the power of the enemy does not create cowardice and fear, but it shakes off indolence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:156
verses.text: "That ye may be able," he saith, "to withstand in the evil day".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:157
verses.text: And he further gives them encouragement too from the time; the time, he seems to say, is short; so that ye must needs stand; faint not when the slaughter is achieved.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:158
verses.text: Moral.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:159
verses.text: If then it is a warfare, if such are the forces arrayed against us, if "the principalities" are incorporeal, if they are "rulers of the world," if they are "the spiritual hosts of wickedness," how, tell me, canst thou live in self-indulgence? How canst thou be dissolute? How if we are unarmed, shall we be able to overcome? These words let every one repeat to himself every day, whenever he is under the influence of anger, or of lust, whenever he is aiming, and all to no profit, after this languid life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:160
verses.text: Let him hearken to the blessed Paul, saying to him, "Our wrestling is not against flesh and blood, but against the principalities, against the powers".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:161
verses.text: A harder warfare this than that which is matter of sense, a fiercer conflict.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:162
verses.text: Think how long time this enemy is wrestling, for what it is that he is fighting, and be more guarded than ever.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:163
verses.text: "Nay," a man will say, "but as he is the devil, he ought to have been removed out of the way, and then all had been saved".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:164
verses.text: These are the pretenses to which some of your indolent ones in self-defense give utterance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:165
verses.text: When thou oughtest to be thankful, O man, that, if thou hast a mind, thou hast the victory over such a foe, thou art on the contrary even discontented, and givest utterance to the words of some sluggish and sleepy soldier.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:166
verses.text: Thou knowest the points of attack, if thou choosest.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:167
verses.text: Reconnoiter on all sides, fortify thyself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:168
verses.text: Not against the devil alone is the conflict, but also against his powers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:169
verses.text: How then, you may say, are we to wrestle with the darkness? By becoming light.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:170
verses.text: How with the "spiritual hosts of wickedness"? By becoming good.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:171
verses.text: For wickedness is contrary to good, and light drives away darkness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:172
verses.text: But if we ourselves too be darkness, we shall inevitably be taken captive.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:173
verses.text: How then shall we overcome them? If, what they are by nature, that we become by choice, free from flesh and blood, thus shall we vanquish them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:174
verses.text: For once it was probable that the disciples would have many persecutors, "imagine not," he would say, "that it is they who war with you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:175
verses.text: They that really war with you, are the spirits that work in them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:176
verses.text: Against them is our conflict".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:177
verses.text: Two things he provides for by these considerations; he renders them in themselves more courageous and he lets loose their wrath against those who war against them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:178
verses.text: And wherefore is our conflict against these? Since we have also an invincible ally, the grace of the Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:179
verses.text: We have been taught an art, such as shall enable us to wrestle not against men, but against spirits.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:180
verses.text: Nay, if we have a mind, neither shall we wrestle at all; for it is because we choose it, that there is a struggle, since so great is the power of Him that dwelleth in us, as that He said, "Behold, I have given you authority to tread upon serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:181
verses.text: (Luke x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:182
verses.text: ) All power hath He given us, both of wrestling and of not wrestling.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:183
verses.text: It is because we are slothful, that we have to wrestle with them; for that Paul wrestled not, hear what he saith himself, "Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? shall tribulation, or anguish, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or sword?" (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:184
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:185
verses.text: ) And again hear his words, "God shall bruise Satan under your feet shortly".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:186
verses.text: (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:187
verses.text: xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:188
verses.text: ) For he had him under his subjection; whence also he said, "I charge thee in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:189
verses.text: (Acts xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:190
verses.text: ) And this is not the language of one wrestling; for he that wrestles has not yet conquered, and he that has conquered no longer wrestles; he has subdued, has taken his captive.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:191
verses.text: And so Peter again wrestled not with the devil, but he did that which was better than wrestling.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:192
verses.text: In the case of the faithful, the obedient, the catechumens, they prevailed over him to vast advantage and over his powers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:193
verses.text: Hence too was it that the blessed Paul said, "For we are not ignorant of his devices" ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:194
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:195
verses.text: ), which was the way moreover in which he especially overcame him; and again hear his words, "And no marvel—if his ministers also fashion themselves as ministers of righteousness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:196
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:197
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:199
verses.text: ) So well knew he every part of the conflict, and nothing escaped him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:200
verses.text: Again, "For the mystery of lawlessness," saith he, "doth already work".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:201
verses.text: ( Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:202
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:203
verses.text: )  But against us is the struggle; for hearken again to him, saying, "I am persuaded, that neither angels, nor principalities, nor things present, nor things to come, nor powers, nor any other creature, shall be able to separate us from the love of Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:204
verses.text: (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:205
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:206
verses.text: ) He saith not simply, "from Christ," but, "from the love of Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:207
verses.text: For many there are who are united forsooth to Christ, and who yet love Him not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:208
verses.text: Not only, saith he, shalt thou not persuade me to deny Him, but, not even to love Him less.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:209
verses.text: And if the powers above had not strength to do this, who else should move him? Not, however, that he saith this, as though they were actually attempting it, but upon the supposition; wherefore also he said, "I am persuaded".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:210
verses.text: So then he did not wrestle, yet nevertheless he fears his artifices; for hear what he saith, "I fear lest by any means, as the serpent beguiled Eve in his craftiness, your minds should be corrupted from the simplicity that is toward Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:211
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:212
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:213
verses.text: ) True, you will say, but he uses this word touching himself also, where he saith, "For I fear lest, by any means, after that I have preached to others, I myself should be rejected".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:214
verses.text: How then art thou "persuaded that no one shall separate thee"? Perceivest thou that the expression is that of lowliness and of humility? For he already dwelt in Heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:215
verses.text: And hence also it was that he said, "For I know nothing against myself" ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:216
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:217
verses.text: ); and again, "I have finished the course".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:218
verses.text: ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:219
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:220
verses.text: ) So that it was not with regard to these matters that the devil placed obstacles in his way, but with reference to the interests of the disciples.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:221
verses.text: And why forsooth? Because in these points he was not himself sole master, but also their own will.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:222
verses.text: There the devil prevailed in some cases; nay, neither there was it over him that he prevailed, but over the indolence of persons who took no heed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:223
verses.text: If indeed, whether from slothfulness, or anything else of the sort, he had failed to fulfill his own duty, then had the devil prevailed over him; but if he himself on his part did all he could, and they obeyed not it was not over him he prevailed, but over their disobedience; and the disease prevailed not over the physician, but over the unruliness of the patient; for, when the physician takes every precaution, and the patient undoes all, the patient is defeated, not the physician.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:224
verses.text: Thus then in no instance did he prevail over Paul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:225
verses.text: But in our own case, it is matter for contentment that we should be so much as able to wrestle.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:226
verses.text: For the Romans indeed this is not what he asks, but what? "He shall bruise Satan under your feet shortly".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:227
verses.text: (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:228
verses.text: xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:229
verses.text: ) And for these Ephesians he invokes, "Him that is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:230
verses.text: (Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:231
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:232
verses.text: ) He that wrestles is still held fast, but it is enough for him that he has not fallen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:233
verses.text: When we depart hence, then, and not till then, will the glorious victory be achieved.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:234
verses.text: For instance, take the case of some evil lust.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:235
verses.text: The extraordinary thing would be, not even to entertain it, but to stifle it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:236
verses.text: If, however, this be not possible, then though we may have to wrestle with it, and retain it to the last, yet if we depart still wrestling, we are conquerors.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:237
verses.text: For the case is not the same here as it is with wrestlers; for there if thou throw not thy antagonist, thou hast not conquered; but here if thou be not thrown, thou hast conquered; if thou art not thrown, thou hast thrown him; and with reason, because there both strive for the victory, and when the one is thrown, the other is crowned; here, however, it is not thus, but the devil is striving for our defeat; when then I strip him of that upon which he is bent, I am conqueror.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:238
verses.text: For it is not to overthrow us, but to make us share his overthrow that he is eager.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:239
verses.text: Already then am I conqueror, for he is already cast down, and in a state of ruin; and his victory consists not in being himself crowned, but in effecting my ruin; so that though I overthrow him not, yet if I be not overthrown, I have conquered.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:240
verses.text: What then is a glorious victory? It is, over and above, to trample him underfoot, as Paul did, by regarding the things of this present world as nothing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:241
verses.text: Let us too imitate him, and strive to become above them, and nowhere to give him a hold upon us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:242
verses.text: Wealth, possessions, vain-glory, give him a hold.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:243
verses.text: And oftentimes indeed this has roused him, and oftentimes exasperated him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:244
verses.text: But what need is there of wrestling? What need of engaging with him? He who is engaged in the act of wrestling has the issue in uncertainty, whether he may not be himself defeated and captured.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:245
verses.text: Whereas he that tramples him under foot, has the victory certain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:246
verses.text: Oh then, let us trample under foot the power of the devil; let us trample under foot our sins, I mean everything that pertains to this life, wrath, lust, vain-glory, every passion; that when we depart to that world, we may not be convicted of betraying that power which God hath given us; for thus shall we attain also the blessings that are to come.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:247
verses.text: But if in this we are unfaithful, who will entrust us with those things which are greater? If we were not able to trample down one who had fallen, who had been disgraced, who had been despised, who was lying beneath our feet, how shall the Father give us a Father's rewards? If we subdue not one so placed in subjection to us, what confidence shall we have to enter into our Father's house? For, tell me, suppose thou hadst a son, and, that he, disregarding the well-disposed part of thy household, should associate with them that have distressed thee, with them that have been expelled his father's house, with them that spend their time at the gaming table, and that he should go on so doing to the very last; will he not be disinherited? It is plain enough he will.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:248
verses.text: And so too shall we; if, disregarding the Angels who have well pleased our Father and whom He hath set over us, we have our conversation with the devil, inevitably we shall be disinherited, which God forbid; but let us engage in the war we have to wage with him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:249
verses.text: If any one hath an enemy, if any one hath been wronged by him, if any one is exasperated, let him collect together all that wrath, all that fierceness, and pour it out upon the head of the devil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:250
verses.text: Here wrath is a good thing, here anger is profitable, here revenge is praiseworthy, for just as amongst the heathen, revenge is a vice, so truly here is revenge a virtue.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:251
verses.text: So then if thou hast any failings, rid thyself of them here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:252
verses.text: And if thou art not able thyself to put them away, do it, though with thy members also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:253
verses.text: Hath any one struck thee? Bear malice against the devil, and never relinquish thy hatred towards him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:254
verses.text: Or again, hath no one struck thee? Yet bear him malice still, because he insulted, because he offended thy Lord and Master, because he injures and wars against thy brethren.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:255
verses.text: With him be ever at enmity, ever implacable, ever merciless.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:256
verses.text: Thus shall he be humbled, thus despicable, thus shall he be an easy prey.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:257
verses.text: If we are fierce towards him, he shall never be fierce towards us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:258
verses.text: If we are compliant, then he will be fierce; it is not with him as it is with our brethren.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:259
verses.text: He is the foe and enemy, both of life and salvation, both ours and his own.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 23:260
verses.text: If he loves not himself, how shall he be able to love us? Let us then put ourselves in array and wound him, having for our mighty confederate the Lord Jesus Christ, who can both render us impregnable to his snares, and worthy of the good things to come; which God grant that we may all attain, through the grace and lovingkindness of our Lord Jesus Christ, with whom, together with the Holy Ghost, be unto the Father, glory, might, and honor, now and ever, and throughout all ages, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:1
verses.text: Homily XXIII.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:2
verses.text: Ephesians vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:3
verses.text: "Stand therefore, having girded your loins with truth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:4
verses.text: Having drawn up this army, and roused their zeal,—for both these things were requisite, both that they should be drawn up in array and subject to each other, and that their spirit should be aroused,—and having inspired them with courage, for this was requisite also, he next proceeds also to arm them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:5
verses.text: For arms had been of no use, had they not been first posted each in his own place, and had not the spirit of the soldier's soul been roused; for we must first arm him within, and then without.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:6
verses.text: Now if this is the case with soldiers, much more is it with spiritual soldiers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:7
verses.text: Or rather in their case, there is no such thing as arming them without, but everything is within.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:8
verses.text: He hath roused their ardor, and set it on fire, he hath added confidence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:9
verses.text: He hath set them in due array.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:10
verses.text: Observe how he also puts on the armor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:11
verses.text: "Stand therefore," saith he.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:12
verses.text: The very first feature in tactics is, to know how to stand well, and many things will depend upon that.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:13
verses.text: Hence he discourses much concerning standing, saying also elsewhere, "Watch ye, stand fast".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:14
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:15
verses.text: xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:16
verses.text: ) And again, "So stand fast in the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:17
verses.text: (Philip.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:18
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:19
verses.text: ) And again, "Let him that thinketh he standeth, take heed lest he fall".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:20
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:21
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:22
verses.text: ) And again, "That ye may be able, having done all, to stand".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:23
verses.text: (Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:24
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:25
verses.text: ) Doubtless then he does not mean merely any way of standing, but a correct way, and as many as have had experience in wars know how great a point it is to know how to stand.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:26
verses.text: For if in the case of boxers and wrestlers, the trainer recommends this before anything else, namely, to stand firm, much more will it be the first thing in warfare, and military matters.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:27
verses.text: The man who, in a true sense, stands, is upright; he stands not in a lazy attitude, not leaning upon anything.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:28
verses.text: Exact uprightness discovers itself by the way of standing, so that they who are perfectly upright, they stand.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:29
verses.text: But they who do not stand, cannot be upright, but are unstrung and disjointed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:30
verses.text: The luxurious man does not stand upright, but is bent; so is the lewd man, and the lover of money.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:31
verses.text: He who knows how to stand will from his very standing, as from a sort of foundation, find every part of the conflict easy to him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:32
verses.text: "Stand therefore," saith he, "having girded your loins with truth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:33
verses.text: He is not speaking of a literal, physical girdle, for all the language in this passage he employs in a spiritual sense.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:34
verses.text: And observe how methodically he proceeds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:35
verses.text: First he girds up his soldier.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:36
verses.text: What then is the meaning of this? The man that is loose in his life, and is dissolved in his lusts, and that has his thoughts trailing on the ground, him he braces up by means of this girdle, not suffering him to be impeded by the garments entangling his legs, but leaving him to run with his feet well at liberty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:37
verses.text: "Stand therefore, having girded your loins," saith he.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:38
verses.text: By the "loins" here he means this; just what the keel is in ships, the same are the loins with us, the basis or groundwork of the whole body: for they are, as it were, a foundation, and upon them as the schools of the physicians tell you, the whole frame is built.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:39
verses.text: So then in "girding up the loins" he compacts the foundation of our soul; for he is not of course speaking of these loins of our body, but is discoursing spiritually: and as the loins are the foundation alike of the parts both above and below, so is it also in the case of these spiritual loins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:40
verses.text: Oftentimes, we know, when persons are fatigued, they put their hands there as if upon a sort of foundation, and in that manner support themselves; and for this reason it is that the girdle is used in war, that it may bind and hold together this foundation, as it were, in our frame; for this reason too it is that when we run we gird ourselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:41
verses.text: It is this which guards our strength.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:42
verses.text: Let this then, saith he, be done also with respect to the soul, and then in doing anything whatsoever we shall be strong; and it is a thing most especially becoming to soldiers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:43
verses.text: True, you may say, but these our natural loins we gird with a leathern band; but we, spiritual soldiers, with what? I answer, with that which is the head and crown of all our thoughts, I mean, "with truth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:44
verses.text: "Having girded your loins," saith he, "with truth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:45
verses.text: What then is the meaning of "with truth"? Let us love nothing like falsehood, all our duties let us pursue "with truth," let us not lie one to another.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:46
verses.text: Whether it be an opinion, let us seek the truth, or whether it be a line of life, let us seek the true one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:47
verses.text: If we fortify ourselves with this, if we "gird ourselves with truth," then shall no one overcome us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:48
verses.text: He who seeks the doctrine of truth, shall never fall down to the earth; for that the things which are not true are of the earth, is evident from this, that all they that are without are enslaved to the passions, following their own reasonings; and therefore if we are sober, we shall need no instruction in the tales of the Greeks.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:49
verses.text: Seest thou how weak and frivolous they are? incapable of entertaining about God one severe thought or anything above human reasoning? Why? Because they are not "girded about with truth"; because their loins, the receptacle of the seed of life, and the main strength of their reasonings, are ungirt; nothing then can be weaker than these.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:50
verses.text: And the Manicheans again, seest thou, how all the things they have the boldness to utter, are from their own reasonings? "It was impossible," say they, "for God to create the world without matter".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:51
verses.text: Whence is this so evident? These things they say, groveling, and from the earth, and from what happens amongst ourselves; because man, they say, cannot create otherwise.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:52
verses.text: Marcion again, look what he says.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:53
verses.text: "God, if He took upon Him flesh, could not remain pure".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:54
verses.text: Whence is this evident? "Because," says he, "neither can men".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:55
verses.text: But men are able to do this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:56
verses.text: Valentinus again, with his reasonings all trailing along the ground, speaks the things of the earth; and in like manner Paul of Samosata.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:57
verses.text: And Arius, what does he say? "It was impossible for God when He begat, to beget without passion".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:58
verses.text: Whence, Arius, hast thou the boldness to allege this; merely from the things which take place amongst ourselves? Seest thou how the reasonings of all these trail along on the ground? All are, as it were, let loose and unconfined, and savoring of the earth? And so much then for doctrines.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:59
verses.text: With regard to life and conduct, again, whoremongers, lovers of money, and of glory, and of everything else, trail on the ground.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:60
verses.text: They have not their loins themselves standing firm, so that when they are weary they may rest upon them; but when they are weary, they do not put their hands upon them and stand upright, but flag.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:61
verses.text: He, however, who "is girt about with the truth," first, never is weary; and secondly, if he should be weary, he will rest himself upon the truth itself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:62
verses.text: What? Will poverty, tell me, render him weary? No, in nowise; for he will repose on the true riches, and by this poverty will understand what is true poverty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:63
verses.text: Or again, will slavery make him weary? No, in nowise, for he will know what is the true slavery.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:64
verses.text: Or shall disease? No, nor even that.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:65
verses.text: "Let your loins," saith Christ, "be girded about, and your lamps burning" (Luke xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:66
verses.text: ), with that light which shall never be put out.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:67
verses.text: This is what the Israelites also, when they were departing out of Egypt (Ex.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:68
verses.text: xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:69
verses.text: ), were charged to do.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:70
verses.text: For why did they eat the passover with their loins girded? Art thou desirous to hear the ground of it? According to the historical fact, or according to its mystical sense, shall I state it? But I will state them both, and do ye retain it in mind, for I am not doing it without an object, merely that I may tell you the solution, but also that my words may become in you reality.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:71
verses.text: They had, we read, their loins girded, and their staff in their hands, and their shoes on their feet, and thus they ate the Passover.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:72
verses.text: Awful and terrible mysteries, and of vast depth; and if so terrible in the type, how much more in the reality? They come forth out of Egypt, they eat the Passover.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:73
verses.text: Attend.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:74
verses.text: "Our Passover hath been sacrificed, even Christ," it is said.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:75
verses.text: Wherefore did they have their loins girded? Their guise is that of wayfarers; for their having shoes, and staves in their hands, and their eating standing, declares nothing else than this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:76
verses.text: Will ye hear the history first, or the mystery? Better the history first.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:77
verses.text: What then is the design of the history? The Jews were continually forgetting God's benefits to them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:78
verses.text: Accordingly then, God tied the sense of these, His benefits, not only to the time, but also to the very habit of them that were to eat.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:79
verses.text: For this is why they were to eat girded and sandalled, that when they were asked the reason, they might say, "we were ready for our journey, we were just about to go forth out of Egypt to the land of promise and we were ready for our exodus".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:80
verses.text: This then is the historical type.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:81
verses.text: But the reality is this; we too eat a Passover, even Christ; "for," saith he, "our Passover hath been sacrificed, even Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:82
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:83
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:84
verses.text: ) What then? We too ought to eat it, both sandalled and girded.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:85
verses.text: And why? That we too may be ready for our Exodus, for our departure hence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:86
verses.text: Moral.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:87
verses.text: Let not any one of them that eat this Passover look towards Egypt, but towards Heaven, towards "Jerusalem that is above".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:88
verses.text: (Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:89
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:90
verses.text: ) On this account thou eatest with thy loins girded, on this account thou eatest with shoes on thy feet, that thou mayest know, that from the moment thou first beginnest to eat the Passover, thou oughtest to set out, and to be upon thy journey.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:91
verses.text: And this implies two things, both that we must depart out of Egypt, and that, whilst we stay, we must stay henceforth as in a strange country; "for our citizenship," saith he, "is in Heaven" (Philip.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:92
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:93
verses.text: ); and that all our life long we should ever be prepared, so that when we are called we may not put it off, but say, "My heart is fixed".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:94
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:95
verses.text: cviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:96
verses.text: ) "Yes, but this Paul indeed could say, who knew nothing against himself; but I, who require a long time for repentance, I cannot say it".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:97
verses.text: Yet that to be girded is the part of a waking soul, hearken to what God says to that righteous man, "Gird up now thy loins like a man, for I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto Me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:98
verses.text: (Job xxxviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:99
verses.text: ) This He says also to all the prophets, and this He says again to Moses, to be girded.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:100
verses.text: And He Himself also appears to Ezekiel (Ezek.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:101
verses.text: ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:102
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:103
verses.text: ) girded.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:104
verses.text: Nay more, and the Angels, too, appear to us girded (Rev.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:105
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:106
verses.text: ), as being soldiers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:107
verses.text: From our being girded about, it comes that we also stand bravely as from our standing our being girded comes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:108
verses.text: For we also are going to depart, and many are the difficulties that intervene.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:109
verses.text: When we have crossed this plain, straightway the devil is upon us, doing everything, contriving every artifice, to the end that those who have been saved out of Egypt, those who have passed the Red Sea, those who are delivered at once from the evil demons, and from unnumbered plagues, may be taken and destroyed by him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:110
verses.text: But, if we be vigilant, we too have a pillar of fire, the grace of the Spirit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:111
verses.text: The same both enlightens and overshadows us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:112
verses.text: We have manna; yea rather not manna, but far more than manna.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:113
verses.text: Spiritual drink we have, not water, that springs forth from the Rock.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:114
verses.text: So have we too our encampment (Rev.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:115
verses.text: xx.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:116
verses.text: ), and we dwell in the desert even now; for a desert indeed without virtue, is the earth even now, even more desolate than that wilderness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:117
verses.text: Why was that desert so terrible? Was it not because it had scorpions in it, and adders? (Deut.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:118
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:119
verses.text: ) "A land," it is said, "which none passed through".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:120
verses.text: (Jer.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:121
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:123
verses.text: Yet is not that wilderness, no, it is not so barren of fruits, as is this human nature.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:124
verses.text: At this instant, how many scorpions, how many asps are in this wilderness, how many serpents, how many "offsprings of vipers" (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:125
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:126
verses.text: ) are these through whom we at this instant pass! Yet let us not be afraid; for the leader of this our Exodus is not Moses, but Jesus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:127
verses.text: How then is it that we shall not suffer the same things? Let us not commit the same acts, and then shall we not suffer the same punishment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:128
verses.text: They murmured, they were ungrateful; let us therefore not cherish these passions.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:129
verses.text: How was it that they fell all of them? "They despised the pleasant land".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:130
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:131
verses.text: cvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:132
verses.text: ) "How 'despised' it? Surely they prized it highly".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:133
verses.text: By becoming indolent and cowardly, and not choosing to undergo any labors to obtain it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:134
verses.text: Let not us then "despise" Heaven! This is what is meant by "despising".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:135
verses.text: Again, among us also has fruit been brought, fruit from Heaven, not the cluster of grapes borne upon the staff (Num.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:136
verses.text: xiii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:137
verses.text: ), but the "earnest of the Spirit" ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:138
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:139
verses.text: ), "the citizenship which is in Heaven" (Philip.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:140
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:141
verses.text: ), which Paul and the whole company of the Apostles, those marvelous husbandmen, have taught us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:142
verses.text: It is not Caleb the son of Jephunneh, nor Jesus the son of Nun, that hath brought these fruits; but Jesus the Son of "the Father of mercies" ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:143
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:144
verses.text: ), the Son of the Very God, hath brought every virtue, hath brought down from Heaven all the fruits that are from thence, the songs of heaven hath He brought.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:145
verses.text: For the words which the Cherubim above say, these hath He charged us to say also, "Holy, Holy, Holy".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:146
verses.text: He hath brought to us the virtue of the Angels.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:147
verses.text: "The Angels marry not, neither are given in marriage" (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:148
verses.text: xxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:149
verses.text: ); this fair plant hath He planted here also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:150
verses.text: They love not money, nor anything like it; and this too hath He sown amongst us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:151
verses.text: They never die; and this hath He freely given us also, for death is no longer death, but sleep.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:152
verses.text: For hearken to what He saith, "Our friend Lazarus is fallen asleep".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:153
verses.text: (John xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:154
verses.text: )  Seest thou then the fruits of "Jerusalem that is above"? (Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:155
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:156
verses.text: ) And what is indeed more stupendous than all is this, that our warfare is not decided, but all these things are given us before the attainment of the promise! For they indeed toiled even after they had entered into the land of promise;—rather, they toiled not, for had they chosen to obey God, they might have taken all the cities, without either arms or array.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:157
verses.text: Jericho, we know, they overturned, more after the fashion of dancers than of warriors.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:158
verses.text: We however have no warfare after we have entered into the land of promise, that is, into Heaven, but only so long as we are in the wilderness, that is, in the present life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:159
verses.text: "For he that is entered into his rest hath himself also rested from his works as God did from His".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:160
verses.text: (Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:161
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:162
verses.text: ) "Let us not then be weary in well-doing, for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:163
verses.text: (Gal.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:164
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:165
verses.text: ) Seest thou how that just as He led them, so also He leads us? In their case, touching the manna and the wilderness, it is said, "He that gathered much had nothing over, and he that gathered little had no lack".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:166
verses.text: (Ex.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:167
verses.text: xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:168
verses.text: ) And we have this charge given us, "not to lay up treasure upon the earth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:169
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:170
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:171
verses.text: ) But if we do lay up treasure, it is no longer the earthly worm that corrupts it, as was the case with the manna, but that which dwelleth eternally with fire.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:172
verses.text: Let us then "subdue all things," that we furnish not food to this worm.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:173
verses.text: For "he," it is said, "who gathered much had nothing over".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:174
verses.text: For this too happens with ourselves also every day.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:175
verses.text: We all of us have but the same capacity of hunger to satisfy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:176
verses.text: And that which is more than this, is but an addition of cares.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:177
verses.text: For what He intended in after-times to deliver, saying, "Sufficient unto the day is the evil thereof" (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:178
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:179
verses.text: ), this had He thus been teaching even from the very beginning, and not even thus did they receive it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:180
verses.text: But as to us, let us not be insatiable, let us not be discontented, let us not be seeking out for splendid houses; for we are on our pilgrimage, not at home; so that if there be any that knows that the present life is a sort of journey, and expedition, and, as one might say, it is what they call an entrenched camp, he will not be seeking for splendid buildings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:181
verses.text: For who, tell me, be he ever so rich, would choose to build a splendid house in an encampment? No one; he would be a laughing stock, he would be building for his enemies, and would the more effectually invite them on; and so then, if we be in our senses, neither shall we.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:182
verses.text: The present life is nothing else than a march and an encampment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:183
verses.text: Wherefore, I beseech you, let us do all we can, so as to lay up no treasure here; for if the thief should come, we must in a moment arise and depart.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:184
verses.text: "Watch," saith He, "for ye know not at what hour the thief cometh" (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:185
verses.text: xxiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:187
verses.text: ), thus naming death.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 24:188
verses.text: O then, before he cometh, let us send away everything before us to our native country; but here let us be "well girded," that we may be enabled to overcome our enemies, whom God grant that we may overcome, through the grace and lovingkindness of our Lord Jesus Christ, with Whom together with the Holy Ghost, be unto the Father glory, strength, honor forever and ever, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:1
verses.text: Homily XXIV.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:2
verses.text: Ephesians vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:3
verses.text: –  "Stand therefore, having girded your loins with truth, and having on the breastplate of righteousness; and having shod your feet with the preparation of the gospel of peace; withal taking up the shield of faith, wherewith ye shall be able to quench all the fiery darts of the evil one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:4
verses.text: And take the helmet of salvation, and the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:5
verses.text: "Having girded your loins," saith he, "with truth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:6
verses.text: What can be the meaning of this? I have stated in the preceding discourse, that he ought to be lightly accoutered, in order that there should be no impediment whatever to his running.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:7
verses.text: "And having on," he continues, "the breastplate of righteousness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:8
verses.text: As the breastplate is impenetrable, so also is righteousness, and by righteousness here he means a life of universal virtue.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:9
verses.text: Such a life no one shall ever be able to overthrow; it is true, many wound him, but no one cuts through him, no, not the devil himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:10
verses.text: It is as though one were to say, "having righteous deeds fixed in the breast"; of these it is that Christ saith, "Blessed are they that hunger and thirst after righteousness; for they shall be filled".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:11
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:12
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:13
verses.text: ) Thus is he firm and strong like a breastplate.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:14
verses.text: Such a man will never be put out of temper.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:15
verses.text: "And having shod your feet with the preparation of the gospel of peace".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:16
verses.text: It is more uncertain in what sense this was said.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:17
verses.text: What then is its meaning? They are noble greaves, doubtless, with which he invests us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:18
verses.text: Either then he means this, that we should be prepared for the gospel, and should make use of our feet for this, and should prepare and make ready its way before it; or if not this, at least that we ourselves should be prepared for our departure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:19
verses.text: "The preparation," then, "of the gospel of peace," is nothing else than a most virtuous life; according to what the Prophet saith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:20
verses.text: "Thou wilt prepare their heart, thou wilt cause thine ear to hear".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:21
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:22
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:23
verses.text: ) "Of the gospel," he says, "of peace," and with reason; for inasmuch as he had made mention of warfare and fighting, he shows us that this conflict with the evil spirits we must needs have: for the gospel is "the gospel of peace"; this war which we have against them, puts an end to another war, that, namely, which is between us and God; if we are at war with the devil, we are at peace with God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:24
verses.text: Fear not therefore, beloved; it is a "gospel," that is, a word of good news; already is the victory won.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:25
verses.text: "Withal taking up the shield of faith".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:26
verses.text: By "faith" in this place, he means, not knowledge, (for that he never would have ranged last,) but that gift by which miracles are wrought.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:27
verses.text: And with reason does he term this "'faith' a shield"; for as the shield is put before the whole body, as if it were a sort of rampart, just so is this faith; for all things yield to it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:28
verses.text: "Wherewith ye shall be able," saith he, "to quench all the fiery darts of the evil one".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:29
verses.text: For this shield nothing shall be able to resist; for hearken to what Christ saith to His disciples, "If ye have faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye shall say unto this mountain, Remove hence to yonder place, and it shall remove".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:30
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:31
verses.text: xvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:32
verses.text: ) But how are we to have this faith? When we have rightly performed all those duties.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:33
verses.text: "By the darts of the evil one," he means, both temptations, and vile desires; and "fiery," he says, for such is the character of these desires.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:34
verses.text: Yet if faith can command the evil spirits, much more can it also the passions of the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:35
verses.text: "And take the helmet," he continues, "of salvation," that is, of your salvation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:36
verses.text: For he is casing them in armor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:37
verses.text: "And the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:38
verses.text: He either means the Spirit, or else, "the spiritual sword": for by this all things are severed, by this all things are cleft asunder, by this we cut off even the serpent's head.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:39
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:41
verses.text: "With all prayer and supplication," saith he, "praying at all seasons in the Spirit, and watching thereunto in all perseverance and supplication for all the saints; and on my behalf that utterance may be given unto me, in opening my mouth to make known with boldness the mystery of the gospel, for which I am an ambassador in chains, that in it I may speak boldly, as I ought to speak".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:42
verses.text: As the word of God has power to do all things, so also has he who has the spiritual gift.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:43
verses.text: "For the word of God," saith he, "is living, and active and sharper than any two-edged sword".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:44
verses.text: (Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:45
verses.text: iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:46
verses.text: ) Now mark the wisdom of this blessed Apostle.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:47
verses.text: He hath armed them with all security.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:48
verses.text: What then is necessary after that? To call upon the King, that He may stretch forth His hand.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:49
verses.text: "With all prayer, and supplication, praying at all seasons in the Spirit"; for it is possible "to pray" not "in the Spirit," when one "uses vain repetitions" (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:50
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:51
verses.text: ); "and watching thereunto," he adds, that is, keeping sober; for such ought the armed warrior, he that stands at the King's side, to be; wakeful and temperate:—"in all perseverance and supplication for all the saints; and on my behalf that utterance may be given unto me in opening my mouth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:52
verses.text: What sayest thou, blessed Paul? Hast thou, then, need of thy disciples? And well does he say, "in opening my mouth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:53
verses.text: He did not then study what he used to say, but according to what Christ said, "When they deliver you up, be not anxious how or what ye shall speak: for it shall be given you in that hour what ye shall speak" (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:54
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:55
verses.text: ): so truly did he do everything by faith, everything by grace.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:56
verses.text: "With boldness," he proceeds, "to make known the mystery of the Gospel"; that is, that I may answer for myself in its defense, as I ought.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:57
verses.text: And art thou bound in thy chain, and still needest the aid of others? Yea, saith he, for so was Peter also bound in his chain, and yet nevertheless "was prayer made earnestly for him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:58
verses.text: (Acts xii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:59
verses.text: ) "For which I am an ambassador in chains, that in it I may speak boldly, as I ought to speak"; that is, that I may answer with confidence, with courage, with great prudence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:60
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:61
verses.text: "But that ye also may know my affairs, how I do, Tychicus, the beloved brother and faithful minister in the Lord, shall make known to you all things".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:62
verses.text: As soon as he had mentioned his chains, he leaves something for Tychicus also to relate to them of his own accord.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:63
verses.text: For whatever topics there were of doctrine and of exhortation, all these he explained by his letter: but what were matters of bare recital, these he entrusted to the bearer of the letter.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:64
verses.text: "That ye may know my affairs," that is, may be informed of them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:65
verses.text: This manifests both the love which he entertained towards them, and their love towards him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:66
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:67
verses.text: "Whom I have sent unto you," saith he, "for this very purpose, that ye may know our state, and that he may comfort your hearts".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:68
verses.text: This language he employs, not without a purpose, but in consequence of what he had been saying previously; "having girded your loins, having on the breastplate," &c.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:69
verses.text: , which are a token of a constant and unceasing advance; for hear what the Prophet saith, "Let it be unto him as the raiment wherewith he covereth himself, and for the girdle wherewith he is girded continually" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:70
verses.text: cix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:71
verses.text: ); and the Prophet Isaiah again saith, that God hath "put on righteousness as a breastplate" (Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:72
verses.text: lix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:73
verses.text: ); by these expressions instructing us that these are things which we must have, not for a short time only, but continually, inasmuch as there is continual need of warfare.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:74
verses.text: "For it is said the righteous are bold as a lion".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:75
verses.text: (Prov.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:76
verses.text: xxviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:77
verses.text: ) For he that is armed with such a breastplate, it cannot be that he should fear the array that is against him, but he will leap into the midst of the enemy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:78
verses.text: And again Isaiah saith, "How beautiful are the feet of him that bringeth good tidings".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:79
verses.text: (Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:80
verses.text: lii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:81
verses.text: ) Who would not run, who would not serve in such a cause; to publish the good tidings of peace, peace between God and man, peace, where men have toiled not, but where God hath wrought all?  But what is the "preparation of the Gospel"? Let us hearken to what John saith, "Make ye ready the way of the Lord, make His paths straight".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:82
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:83
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:84
verses.text: ) But again there is need also of another "preparation" after baptism, so that we may do nothing unworthy of "peace".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:85
verses.text: And then, since the feet are usually a token of the way of life, hence he is constantly exhorting in this language, "Look, therefore, carefully how ye walk".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:86
verses.text: (Eph.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:87
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:88
verses.text: ) On this account, he would say, let us exhibit a practice and example worthy of the Gospel; that is, make our life and conduct pure.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:89
verses.text: The good tidings of peace have been proclaimed to you, give to these good tidings a ready way; since if ye again become enemies, there is no more "preparation of peace".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:90
verses.text: Be ready, be not backward to embrace this peace.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:91
verses.text: As ye were ready and disposed for peace and faith, so also continue.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:92
verses.text: The shield is that which first receives the assaults of the adversary, and preserves the armor uninjured.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:93
verses.text: So long then as faith be right and the life be right, the armor remains uninjured.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:94
verses.text: He discourses, however, much concerning faith, but most especially in writing to the Hebrews, as he does also concerning hope.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:95
verses.text: Believe, saith he, in the good things to come, and none of this armor shall be injured.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:96
verses.text: In dangers, in toils, by holding out thy hope and thy faith to protect thee, thou wilt preserve thy armor uninjured.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:97
verses.text: "He that cometh to God must believe that He is, and that He is a rewarder of them that seek after Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:98
verses.text: (Heb.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:99
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:100
verses.text: ) Faith is a shield; but wherever there are quibbles, and reasonings, and scrutinizings, then is it no longer a shield, but it impedes us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:101
verses.text: Let this our faith be such as shall cover and screen the whole frame.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:102
verses.text: Let it not then be scanty, so as to leave the feet or any other part exposed, but let the shield be commensurate with the whole body.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:103
verses.text: "Fiery darts".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:104
verses.text: For many doubtful reasonings there are, which set the soul, as it were, on fire, many difficulties, many perplexities, but all of them faith sets entirely at rest; many things does the devil dart in, to inflame our soul and bring us into uncertainty; as, for example, when some persons say, "Is there then a resurrection?" "Is there a judgment?" "Is there a retribution?" "But is there faith?" the apostle would say, "thou shalt with it quench the darts of the devil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:105
verses.text: Has any base lust assaulted thee? Hold before thee thy faith in the good things to come, and it will not even show itself, yea, it will perish".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:106
verses.text: "All the darts"; not some quenched, and others not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:107
verses.text: Hearken to what Paul saith, "For I reckon that the sufferings of this present time are not worthy to be compared with the glory that shall be revealed to us-ward".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:108
verses.text: (Rom.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:109
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:110
verses.text: ) Seest thou how many darts the righteous quenched in those days? Seemeth it not to thee to be "fiery darts," when the patriarch burned with inward fire, as he was offering up his son? Yea, and other righteous men also have quenched "all his darts".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:111
verses.text: Whether then they be reasonings that assault us, let us hold out this; or whether they be base desires, let us use this; or whether again labors and distresses, upon this let us repose.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:112
verses.text: Of all the other armor, this is the safeguard; if we have not this, they will be quickly pierced through.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:113
verses.text: "Withal," saith he, "taking up the shield of faith".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:114
verses.text: What is the meaning of "withal"? It means both "in truth," and "in righteousness," and "in the preparation of the gospel"; that is to say, all these have need of the aid of faith.
