verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:115
verses.text: And therefore he adds further, "and take the helmet of salvation"; that is to say, finally by this shall ye be able to be in security.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:116
verses.text: To receive the helmet of salvation is to escape the peril.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:117
verses.text: For as the helmet covers the head perfectly in every part, and suffers it not to sustain any injury, but preserves it, so also does faith supply alike the place of a shield, and of a helmet to preserve us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:118
verses.text: For if we quench his darts, quickly shall we receive also those saving thoughts that suffer not our governing principle to sustain any harm; for if these, the thoughts that are adverse to our salvation, are quenched, those which are not so, but which contribute to our salvation, and inspire us with good hopes, will be generated within us, and will rest upon our governing principle, as a helmet does upon the head.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:119
verses.text: And not only this, but we shall take also "the sword of the Spirit," and thus not only ward off his missiles, but smite the devil himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:120
verses.text: For a soul that does not despair of herself, and is proof against those fiery darts, will stand with all intrepidity to face the enemy, and will cleave open his breastplate with this very sword with which Paul also burst through it, and "brought into captivity his devices" ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:121
verses.text: x.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:122
verses.text: ); he will cut off and behead the serpent.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:123
verses.text: "Which is the word of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:124
verses.text: By the "word of God" in this place, he means on the one hand the ordinance of God, or the word of command; or on the other that it is in the Name of Christ.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:125
verses.text: For if we keep his commandments, by these we shall kill and slay the dragon himself, "the crooked serpent".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:126
verses.text: (Isa.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:127
verses.text: xxvii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:128
verses.text: ) And as he said, "Ye shall be able to quench the fiery darts of the evil one"; that he might not puff them up, he shows them, that above all things they stand in need of God; for what does he say?  "With all prayer and supplication," he says, these things shall be done, and ye shall accomplish all by praying.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:129
verses.text: But when thou drawest near, never ask for thyself only: thus shalt thou have God favorable to thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:130
verses.text: "With all prayer and supplication, praying at all seasons in the Spirit, and watching thereunto in all perseverance for all the saints".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:131
verses.text: Limit it not, I say, to certain times of the day, for hear what he is saying; approach at all times; "pray," saith he, "without ceasing".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:132
verses.text: ( Thess.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:133
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:134
verses.text: ) Hast thou never heard of that widow, how by her importunity she prevailed? (Luke xviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:136
verses.text: ) Hast thou never heard of that friend, who at midnight shamed his friend into yielding by his perseverance? (Luke xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:138
verses.text: ) Hast thou not heard of the Syrophoenician woman (Mark vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:140
verses.text: ), how by the constancy of her entreaty she called forth the Lord's compassion? These all of them gained their object by their importunity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:141
verses.text: "Praying at all seasons," saith he, "in the Spirit".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:142
verses.text: That is to say, let us seek for the things which are according to God, nothing of this world, nothing pertaining to this life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:143
verses.text: Therefore, is there need not only that we "pray without ceasing," but also, that we should do so "watching;—and watching," saith he, "thereunto".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:144
verses.text: Whether he is here speaking of vigils; or of the wakefulness of the soul, I admit both meanings.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:145
verses.text: Seest thou how that Canaanitish woman watched unto prayer? and though the Lord gave her no answer, nay, even shook her off, and called her a dog, she said, "Yea, Lord: for even the dogs eat of the crumbs which fall from their masters' table" (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:146
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:147
verses.text: ), and desisted not until she obtained her request.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:148
verses.text: How, too, did that widow cry, and persist so long, until she was able to shame into yielding that ruler, that neither feared God, nor regarded man (Luke xviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:150
verses.text: )? And how, again, did the friend persist, remaining before the door in the dead of night, till he shamed the other into yielding by his importunity, and made him arise.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:151
verses.text: (Luke xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:153
verses.text: ) This is to be watchful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:154
verses.text: Wouldest thou understand what watchfulness in prayer is? Go to Hannah, hearken to her very words, "Adonai Eloi Sabaoth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:155
verses.text: ( Sam.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:156
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:157
verses.text: ) Nay, rather, hear what preceded those words; "they all rose up," says the history, "from the table" ( Sam.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:158
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:159
verses.text: ), and she, forthwith, did not betake herself to sleep, nor to repose.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:160
verses.text: Whence she appears to me even when she was sitting at the table to have partaken lightly, and not to have been made heavy with viands.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:161
verses.text: Otherwise never could she have shed so many tears; for if we, when we are fasting and foodless, hardly pray thus, or rather never pray thus, much more would not she ever have prayed thus after a meal, unless even at the meal she had been as they that eat not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:162
verses.text: Let us be ashamed, us that are men, at the example of this woman; let us be ashamed, that are suing and gasping for a kingdom, at her, praying and weeping for a little child.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:163
verses.text: "And she stood," it says, "before the Lord" ( Sam.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:164
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:165
verses.text: ); and what are her words? "Adonai, Lord, Eloi Sabaoth!" and this is, being interpreted, "O Lord, the God of Hosts".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:166
verses.text: Her tears went before her tongue; by these she hoped to prevail with God to bend to her request.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:167
verses.text: Where tears are, there is always affliction also: where affliction is, there is great wisdom and heedfulness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:168
verses.text: "If thou wilt indeed," she continues, "look on the affliction of thine handmaid, and wilt give unto thine handmaid a man child, then will I give him unto the Lord all the days of his life".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:169
verses.text: ( Sam.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:170
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:171
verses.text: ) She said not, "for one year," or, "for two," as we do;—nor said she, "if thou wilt give me a child, I will give thee money"; but, "I give back to Thee the very gift itself entire, my first-born, the son of my prayer".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:172
verses.text: Truly here was a daughter of Abraham.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:173
verses.text: He gave when it was demanded of him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:174
verses.text: She offers even before it is demanded.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:175
verses.text: But observe even after this her deep reverence.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:176
verses.text: "Only her lips moved, but her voice," it saith, "was not heard".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:177
verses.text: ( Sam.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:178
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:179
verses.text: ) And thus does he who would gain his request draw nigh unto God; not consulting his ease, nor gaping, nor lounging, nor scratching his head, nor with utter listlessness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:180
verses.text: What, was not God able to grant, even without any prayer at all? What, did He not know the woman's desire even before she asked? And yet had He granted it before she asked, then the woman's earnestness would not have been shown, her virtue would not have been made manifest, she would not have gained so great a reward.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:181
verses.text: So that the delay is not the result of envy or of witchcraft, but of providential kindness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:182
verses.text: When therefore ye hear the Scripture saying, that "the Lord had shut up her womb" (ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:184
verses.text: ), and that, "her rival provoked her sore"; consider that it is His intention to prove the woman's seriousness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:185
verses.text: For, mark, she had a husband devoted to her, for he said (ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:186
verses.text: ), "Am I not better to thee than ten sons?" "And her rival," it saith, "provoked her sore," that is, reproached her, insulted over her.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:187
verses.text: And yet did she never once retaliate, nor utter imprecation against her, nor say, "Avenge me, for my rival reviles me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:188
verses.text: The other had children, but this woman had her husband's love to make amends.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:189
verses.text: With this at least he even consoled her, saying, "Am not I better to thee than ten sons?"  But let us look, again, at the deep wisdom of this woman.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:190
verses.text: "And Eli," it says, "thought she had been drunken".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:191
verses.text: (Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:192
verses.text: ) Yet observe what she says to him also, "Nay, count not thine handmaid for a daughter of Belial, for out of the abundance of my complaint and my provocation have I spoken hitherto".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:193
verses.text: (Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:194
verses.text: ) Here is truly the proof of a contrite heart, when we are not angry with those that revile us, when we are not indignant against them, when we reply but in self-defense.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:195
verses.text: Nothing renders the heart so wise as affliction; nothing is there so sweet as "godly mourning".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:196
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:197
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:198
verses.text: ) "Out of the abundance," saith she, "of my complaint and my provocation have I spoken hitherto".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:199
verses.text: Her let us imitate, one and all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:200
verses.text: Hearken, ye that are barren, hearken, ye that desire children, hearken, both husbands and wives; yes, for husbands, too, used oftentimes to contribute their part; for hear what the Scripture saith, "And Isaac intreated the Lord for Rebekah his wife, because she was barren".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:201
verses.text: (Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:202
verses.text: xxv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:203
verses.text: ) For prayer is able to accomplish great things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:204
verses.text: "With all prayer and supplication," saith he, "for all the saints, and for me," placing himself last.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:205
verses.text: What doest thou, O blessed Paul, in thus placing thyself last? Yea, saith he, "that utterance may be given unto me, in opening my mouth, to make known with boldness the mystery of the gospel, for which I am an ambassador in chains".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:206
verses.text: And where art thou an ambassador? "To mankind," saith he.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:207
verses.text: Oh! amazing lovingkindness of God! He sent from Heaven in His own Name ambassadors for peace, and lo, men took them, and bound them, and reverenced not so much as the law of nations, that an ambassador never suffers any hurt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:208
verses.text: "But, however, I am an ambassador in bonds.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:209
verses.text: The chain lies like a bridle upon me, restraining my boldness, but your prayer shall open my mouth" in order that I may speak all things I was sent to speak.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:210
verses.text: "But that ye also may know my affairs, how I do, Tychicus, the beloved brother, and faithful minister in the Lord, shall make known to you all things".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:211
verses.text: If "faithful," he will tell no falsehood, he will in everything speak the truth:—"whom I have sent unto you for this very purpose, that ye might know our state, and that he may comfort your hearts".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:212
verses.text: Amazing, transcendent affection! "that it may not be in the power," he means, "of them that would, to affright you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:213
verses.text: For it is probable that they were in tribulation; for the expression, "may comfort your hearts," intimates as much; that is, "may not suffer you to sink under it".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:214
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:215
verses.text: "Peace be to the brethren and love with faith from God the Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:216
verses.text: He invokes upon them, "peace and love with faith".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:217
verses.text: He saith well: for he would not that they should have regard to love by itself, and mingle themselves with those of a different faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:218
verses.text: Either he means this, or that above described, namely, that they should have faith also, so as to have a cheerful confidence of the good things to come.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:219
verses.text: The "peace" which is towards God, and the "love".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:220
verses.text: And if there be peace, there will also be love; if love, there will be peace also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:221
verses.text: "With faith," because without faith, love amounts to nothing; or rather love could not exist at all without it.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:222
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:223
verses.text: "Grace be with all them that love our Lord Jesus Christ in uncorruptness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:224
verses.text: Why does he separate the two here, placing "peace" by itself, and "grace" by itself?  "In uncorruptness," he concludes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:225
verses.text: What is this, "in uncorruptness"? It either means, "in purity"; or else, "for the sake of those things which are incorruptible," as, for example, not in riches, nor in glory, but in those treasures which are incorruptible.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:226
verses.text: The "in" means, "through".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:227
verses.text: "Through uncorruptness," that is, "through virtue".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:228
verses.text: Because all sin is corruption.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:229
verses.text: And in the same way as we say a virgin is corrupted, so also do we speak of the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:230
verses.text: Hence Paul says, "Lest by any means your minds should be corrupted".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:231
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:232
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:233
verses.text: ) And again elsewhere, he says, "In doctrine, showing uncorruptness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:234
verses.text: For what, tell me, is corruption of the body? Is it not the dissolution of the whole frame, and of its union? This then is what takes place also in the soul when sin enters.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:235
verses.text: The beauty of the soul is temperance, and righteousness; the health of the soul is courage, and prudence; for the base man is hideous in our eyes, so is the covetous, so is the man who gives himself up to evil practices, and so the coward and unmanly man is sick, and the foolish man is out of health.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:236
verses.text: Now that sins work corruption, is evident from this, that they render men base, and weak, and cause them to be sick and diseased.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:237
verses.text: Nay, and when we say that a virgin is corrupted, we say so, strictly speaking, on this account also, not only because the body is defiled, but because of the transgression.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:238
verses.text: For the mere act is natural; and if in that consisted the "corruption," then were marriage corruption.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:239
verses.text: Hence is it not the act that is corruption, but the sin, for it dishonors and puts her to shame.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:240
verses.text: And again, what would be corruption in the case of a house? Its dissolution.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:241
verses.text: And so, universally, corruption is a change which takes place for the worse, a change into another state, to the utter extinction of the former one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:242
verses.text: For hear what the Scripture saith, "All flesh had corrupted his way" (Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:243
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:244
verses.text: ); and again, "In intolerable corruption" (Ex.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:245
verses.text: xviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:246
verses.text: ); and again, "Men corrupted in mind".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:247
verses.text: ( Tim.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:248
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:249
verses.text: ) Our body is corruptible, but our soul is incorruptible.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:250
verses.text: Oh then, let us not make that corruptible also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:251
verses.text: This, the corruption of the body, was the work of former sin; but sin which is after the Laver, has the power also to render the soul corruptible, and to make it an easy prey to "the worm that dieth not".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:252
verses.text: For never had that worm touched it, had it not found the soul corruptible.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:253
verses.text: The worm touches not adamant, and even if he touches it, he can do it no harm.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:254
verses.text: Oh then, corrupt not the soul; for that which is corrupted is full of foul stench; for hearken to the Prophet who saith, "My wounds stink and are corrupt because of my foolishness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:255
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:256
verses.text: xxxviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:257
verses.text: )  However, "this corruption" of the body "shall put on incorruption" ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:258
verses.text: xv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:259
verses.text: ), but the other of the soul, never; for where incorruption is, there is no corruption.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:260
verses.text: Thus is it a corruption which is incorruptible, which hath no end, a deathless death; which would have been, had the body remained deathless.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:261
verses.text: Now if we shall depart into the next world having not corruption, we have that corruption incorruptible and endless; for to be ever burning, and not burnt up, ever wasted by the worm, is corruption incorruptible; like as was the case with the blessed Job.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:262
verses.text: He was corrupted, and died not, and that through a lengthened period, and "wasted continually, scraping the clods of dust from his sore".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:263
verses.text: Some such torment as this shall it undergo, when the worms surround and devour it, not for two years nor for three, nor for ten, nor for ten thousand, but for years without end; for "their worm," saith He, "dieth not".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:264
verses.text: Moral.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:265
verses.text: Let us take the alarm then, I entreat you, let us dread the words, that we meet not with the realities.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:266
verses.text: Covetousness is corruption, corruption more dangerous than any other, and leading on to idolatry.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:267
verses.text: Let us shun the corruption, let us choose the incorruption.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:268
verses.text: Hast thou in covetousness overreached and defrauded some one? The fruits of thy covetousness perish, but the covetousness remains; a corruption which is the foundation of incorruptible corruption.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:269
verses.text: The enjoyment indeed passes away, but the sin remains imperishable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:270
verses.text: A fearful evil is it for us not to strip ourselves of everything in this present world; a great calamity to depart into the next with loads of sins about us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:271
verses.text: "For in Sheol," it is said "who shall give Thee thanks?" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:272
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:273
verses.text: ) There is the place of judgment; then is there no longer season for repentance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:274
verses.text: How many things did the rich man bewail then? (Luke xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:275
verses.text: ) And yet it availed him nothing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:276
verses.text: How many things did they say who had neglected to feed Christ? (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:277
verses.text: xxv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:278
verses.text: ) Yet were they led away notwithstanding into the everlasting fire.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:279
verses.text: How many things had they then to say: "that had wrought iniquity"; "Lord, did we not prophesy by Thy Name, and by Thy Name cast out devils?" And yet notwithstanding, they were not owned.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:280
verses.text: All these things therefore will take place then; but it will be of no avail, if they be not done now.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:281
verses.text: Let us fear then, lest ever we should have to say then, "Lord, when saw we Thee an hungered, and fed Thee not?" (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:282
verses.text: xxv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:283
verses.text: ) Let us feed Him now, not one day, nor two, nor three days.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:284
verses.text: "For let not mercy and truth," saith the Wise Man, "forsake thee".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:285
verses.text: (Prov.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:286
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:287
verses.text: ) He saith not "do it once, nor twice".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:288
verses.text: The Virgins, we know, had oil, but not enough to last out.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:289
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:290
verses.text: xxv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:292
verses.text: ) And thus we need much oil, and thus should we be "like a green olive tree in the house of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:293
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:294
verses.text: lii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:295
verses.text: ) Let us reflect then how many burdens of sins each of us has about him, and let us make our acts of mercy counterbalance them; nay rather, far exceed them, that not only the sins may be quenched, but that the acts of righteousness may be also accounted unto us for righteousness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Ephesianss 25:296
verses.text: For if the good deeds be not so many in number as to put aside the crimes laid against us, and out of the remainder to be counted unto us for righteousness, then shall no one rescue us from that punishment, from which God grant that we may be all delivered, through the grace and lovingkindness of our Lord Jesus Christ, with whom to the Father, &c.
